loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Doña Luisa de 51 años de edad, empezó a trabajar desde la edad de 15 años en servicios doméstico, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad algunos viven con ella y otros que se han independizado, su pareja trabaja en carpintería por su propia cuenta, sus créditos los ha utilizado en mejora de infraestructura de su vivienda, su ultimo logro fue construir el muro de la parte trasera e instalo inodoros y lavanderos dentro de su hogar, ahora con este nuevo crédito desea instalar las ventanas de aluminio y vidrio ya que solo tiene verjas, comprara celosías, vidrios escarchados y lisos, de esa manera ir terminando paso a paso con su vivienda para la comodidad y seguridad de su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Luisa, fifty-one, started working as a housekeeper when she was fifteen. Her children are now adults. Some of them are independent and the rest live with her. Her partner works on his own as a carpenter.

She has used the previous loans for improving her house. The latest improvements she made were building a wall in the back of her house and installing toilets and sinks inside the house. She wants to use this new loan to buy glass and aluminum frames for her windows, since she only has wrought-iron grilles. She will buy glass louvers, frosted glass and flat glass. She plans to finish building her house, step by step, for the family’s comfort and safety.

loans.use: to buy aluminum frames, and frosted and flat glass.

loans.name: Sire's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé le 22 Mars 2001. Ses membres habitent en majorité la même localité et évoluent dans le commerce de détail.
Mme Sira, habillée en jaune et levant la main, est l'emprunteur en vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et âgée de 38 ans. Elle s'active dans la vente de légumes frais et de poissons fumés. Elle a plus de 10 ans d'expérience dans ce secteur. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des sacs de différentes légumes pour une valeur de 100.000 et des paniers de poissons fumés d'une valeur de 350.000 frs. Le reste du prêt lui servira de transport et autre frais divers.
Avec les revenus générés par son activité, Mme sira compte augmenter son épargne et appuyer son époux dans la gestion des charges familiales.
texts.en:
This group was created March 22, 2001.   Its members mostly live in the same area and are involved in retail sales. 

Mrs. Sira, dressed in yellow and raising her hand, is the leading entrepreneur of the group.  She is 38 years old and married.  She is in the business of selling fresh vegetables and smoked fish.  She has more than ten years of experience with this type of work.  With this loan, she plans to buy sacks of different types of vegetables for 100,000, and baskets of smoked fish for 350,000 frs. The rest of the loan will pay transportation and various other expenses.  
With income generated from her work, Mrs. Sira plans to increase her savings and to assist her husband with paying family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fish and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Roya's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est inauguré le 13 juin 2008. Ses membres sont ensemble par affinité dans le même quartier et les environs. Elles s'activent en majorité dans le petit commerce, la couture et l'aviculture.
Mme Khardiatou est l'emprunteur en vedette; sur la photo, elle est à droite avec la main levée. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfant, dont une fille de 06 ans et un garçon de 08 ans. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des tissus, de la garniture et confectionner des draps, des nappes de table, des habits pour hommes et femmes.
Avec les bénéfices qu'elle va avoir, cette dame compte accroitre son épargne et subvenir aus besoins primaires de sa famille:nourriture, santé et scolarité.
texts.en:
This group was created on June 13, 2008.  Its members all live near each other.  They are mostly involved in sales, sewing, and raising poultry. 

Mrs. Khardiatou is the leading entrepreneur of the group.  In the photo she is to the right with her hand raised.  She is married and the mother of two children; a six year old girl and an eight year old boy.  With this loan, she plans to buy fabric and accessories to make curtains, tablecloths, and men and women’s clothing. 

With her profits, this woman plans to  build up her savings and to cover the primary needs of her family:  food, healthcare, and education.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing, curtains, and tablecloths.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and various other goods

loans.name: Ndack's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe existe depuis le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 29 femmes issues du même village, elles sont en bonne entente et ont comme principales activités le commerce et l'embouche.
Madame Ndack l'emprunteur vedette est âgée de 38 ans, mariée elle est mère de 3 enfants 2 filles, 1 garçon. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de chaussures, de sacs et ustensiles de cuisine elle a une bonne expérience de plusieurs années.Sur la photo elle est debout à droite  vêtue en robe multicolore et a levé la main gauche.
Elle achéte ses chaussures, sacs, bols, assiettes.... à Louga et revend au marché de son village.

Elle envisage avec son prêt acheter 20 sacs à main, 25 paires de chaussures et des tissus pour ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus à la vente.  

Avec ses bénéfices elle souhaite développer son épargne pour atteindre rapidement le plafond du prêt spécial.
texts.en:
This group has existed since December 30, 2009.  It is composed of 29 women from the same village.  They get along well with each other and their main activities are sales and raising livestock.

Mrs. Ndack, the leading borrower of the group, is 38 years old, and the mother of three children:  two girls and one boy.  She runs a small business selling shoes, hand bags, and  kitchen utensils.  She has several years experience with this type of work.  In the photo she is standing to the right and dressed in a multi-colored dress, with her hand raised. 

She buys her shoes, hand bags, bowls, plates, etc., in Louga to re-sell at the market in her village.

She foresees, with her loan, buying 20 hand bags, 25 pairs of shoes, and fabric in order to earn substantial income from her sales. 

With her profits, she would like to build up her savings in order to be able to pay back her loan quickly. 

.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mbayang's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé le 30 décembre 2009.Le groupe est constitué de 26 femmes. Elles habitent le même village et sont en bonne entente.

La présidente de ce groupe Bineta est une femme mariée de 45 ans avec 04 enfants dont 02 filles.Elle fait du petit commerce et de l'embouche.Durant la saison des pluies elle fait aussi du lait caillé. Sur la photo, elle est debout avec une écharpe noire sur l'épaule.

Avec son prêt, elle voudrait acheter 03 sujets à 25000F chacun, de l'aliment bétail(02 sacs à 16000f)et dépenser 9000f pour les frais de transport.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle va augmenter ses épargnes pour prétendre à un prêt plus élevé.
texts.en:
This group of 26 women was created on December 30th, 2009. The members all live in the same village and get along well. 

The group’s president is Bineta, age 45. In the photo, she is the one standing with a black scarf on her shoulder. Bineta is married with four children, two boys and two girls. Her business activities are small trade and cattle fattening. During the rainy season, she also makes curdled milk. 

She will use her loan to buy three heads of cattle at 25,000F each and two bags of cattle feed for 16,000F. She will also spend 9,000F on transport.

With her profits, she plans to bolster her savings to qualify for larger loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies and cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: La joven mercedes tiene la edad de 30 años, su esposo trabaja en un mercado de Managua prestando servicios de acarreo, tiene dos hijos siendo el mayor de 13 años quienes asisten a la escuela, mercedes vendía fritanga comida típica en su casa para cubrir los gastos del hogar, pero se vio mal de salud a causa del trabajo pesado de liderar con el calor del fuego, encontró otra alternativa de negocio la venta de ropa variada que poco a poco la ha ido empleando. Para seguir mejorando su entorno de vida solicita crédito para levantar el muro perimetral de su casa por lo que necesitara comprar materiales como cemento, arena, hierro, bloques, piedra cantera y el pago de la mano de obra, con esta construcción asegurara un poco más su vivienda, una vez terminado este pequeño proyecto de infraestructura optara por otro préstamo para seguir mejorando ya que solo con crédito se puede progresar.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 30-years-old; her husband works in a market in Managua providing hauling services.  She has two children, her oldest is 13-years-old, who attend school.  Mercedes used to sell traditional fast-food at home to cover household expenses but her health was affected by the hard work in front of the hot fire so she found another business alternative; she’s now been gradually moving into selling varied clothes.

In order to continue improving her home environment, she’s requesting a loan to erect a wall around her house and needs to buy materials like cement, sand, rebar, concrete blocks, paving stones and to pay labor costs to do so.  With this construction she will make her house a little safer.  Once she completes this small infrastructure project she will opt for a new loan to continue improving because progress is possible only by means of credit.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, rebar, concrete blocks, paving stones and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Faye's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe existe depuis le 2009. Il est constitué de 02 femmes très dynamiques. Elles habitent le même village et sont en bonne entente.

La responsable de ce groupe,Faye est une femmes mariée de 43 ans avec 03 filles. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, son cheptel est assez fourni et elle capitalise une bonne expérience.
Sur la photo, elle est à droite avec la main levée.

Avec son prêt, elle voudrait acheter 02 bœufs à 250000 F chacun,50 charges de foin à 100000f et 40 sacs d'aliment bétail à 8000f chacun.

Avec ses bénéfices elle veut renforcer ses épargnes et son activité.
texts.en:
This group was created in 2009. It consists of two very enthusiastic women who live in the same village and get along well. 

The group leader is Faye, age 43, a married mother of three girls. In the photo, she is the one on the right with her hand raised. Her activity is cattle fattening. Her livestock is substantial and she has a good experience in this line of work. 

She will use her loan to buy two oxen at 250,000 F each, 50 loads of hay for 100,000F and 40 bags of cattle feed at 8,000F each.

With her profits, she plans to bolster her savings and strengthen her activity.

loans.use: to buy oxen for her fattening activity.

loans.name: Magatte's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe existe depuis le 30 décembre 2009, il est composé de 37 femmes issues du même village, elles sont en bonne entente et ont comme principales activités le commerce et l'embouche.
Madame Fatou l'emprunteur vedette est âgée de 36 ans, divorcée elle est mère de 6 enfants 3 filles, 3 garçons. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de produits alimentaires et également de l'embouche ovine et bovine; elle a une bonne expérience de plusieurs années.Sur la photo elle est debout à droite  vêtue en sari rose-marron-beige et a levé la main gauche.
Elle s'approvisionne en produits riz,huile,mil..... à Louga et revend dans son village où elle posséde une boutique à côté de chez elle.

Elle envisage avec son prêt augmenter la quantité en achetant 10 sacs de riz et 10 sacs de mil  et espère ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus à la vente.  

Avec les bénéfices attendus, elle souhaite diversifier son activité en investissant dans l'embouche.
texts.en:
This group has been in existence since December 30, 2009. It is made up of 37 women from the same village. They get along well and all work mainly in business and animal fattening.
Madame Fatou, the lead borrower, is 36 years old. Divorced, she is the mother of 6 children (3 girls, 3 boys). As a business, she sells food products and also practices beef and mutton fattening. She has several years of experience. In the photo, she is standing up at the right, wearing a pink-brown-beige sari and raising her left hand.
She stocks up in rice, oil, and millet in Louga and resells in her village where she has a store next to her home.

With this loan, she images increasing her stock by buying 10 bags of rice and 10 bags of millet and hopes thus to make a lot of profit upon their sale.

With the profits anticipated, she wishes to diversify her business by investing in the fattening business..

loans.use: to buy rice and millet for resale.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 13 Décembre 2008. Les 26 membres qui composent le groupe ont une bonne cohésion entre elles. Elles exercent toutes la même activité qu'est le petit commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo, Thioro la vedette est âgée de 67 ans , elle est veuve et mère d'un garçon et six filles. 

Son prêt reçu, elle va acheter du mil, du sucre et de l'huile qu'elle va revendre dans le village ainsi que des moutons. Elle achète le kg de mil à 75 f et revend à 250 f et le mouton à 7 500 f pour revendre à 25 000f. 

Avec les bénéfices générés par son activité, elle va participer à la prise en charge de sa progéniture en leur soutenant dans l'alimentation, la scolarité et les soins sanitaires en cas de besoins.
texts.en:
The group was created on December 13, 2008. The 26 members that make up the group have good social cohesion amongst themselves. They all practice the same line of work, which is small business.

Standing up at the right of the photo, Thioro, the leader, is 67 years old. She is a widow, and mother of one boy and six girls.

Once she receives her loan, she is going to buy millet, sugar, and oil, which she is going to resell in the village, as well as sheep. She buys millet at 75XOF/kg and resells it at 250XOF, and the sheep at 7500XOF, to resell at 25,000XOF. 

With the profits generated from this business, she is going to participate in meeting the expenses of her children, supporting them in nutrition, education, and healthcare if needed.

loans.use: to buy millet, sugar, oil, and sheep to resell.

loans.name: Khadiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé le 25 Août 2011 au jour d’inauguration du banc villageois, une paix sociale anime la vie du groupe qui compte 25 femmes qui vivent dans le même village. Les membres ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Khadidiatou (assise à l’extrême droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants (02 garçons et 02 filles), elle prend aussi en charge 02 de ses neveux. Elle est gérante d’une gargote au village où elle sert le petit déjeuner. En plus de cette activité elle vend de l’encens, place à crédit aux femmes du village.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter un sac de riz, un carton de lait, de l’encens et des parfums pour faire le mélange.

Les bénéfices lui permettront  d’appuyer son mari dans la prise charges de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on August 25, 2011, upon the inauguration of the local Banc Villageois. It is a peaceful group that consists of 25 women from the same village. Their main activity is small trade.

Mrs. Khadiatou (sitting at the far right) is the featured borrower. She is a 39-year-old married mother of four children, two girls and two boys. She also looks after two of her nephews. She runs a luncheonette in the village where she serves breakfast. As a secondary activity, she also sells incense to the women of the area, sometimes on credit. 

This new loan will allow her to buy one bag of rice, one carton of milk, some incense and perfumes to mix various scents. 

She will use her profits to help her husband to support the children’s education.

loans.use: to buy one bag of rice, one carton of milk, some incense and perfumes to mix various scents.

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée le 24 octobre 2007. Les 36 membres qui composent le groupe habitent toutes la communauté rurale et fréquentent les mêmes marchés. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la vedette Fatou est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 6 filles et 2 garçons. 

Son prêt reçu, elle achète des perles de différentes couleurs et fabrique des bijoux. En parallèle, elle vend des balais et d'autres menus articles. 

Avec les bénéfices elle paie ses intérêts, renforce ses épargnes et améliore les besoins de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
This group was created on October 24th, 2007. It consists of 36 members who all live in the same rural community and shop at the same markets. 

The featured borrower is Fatou, age 57, seen standing at the far right in the photo with her hand raised. She is a married mother of six girls and two boys.  

She will use her loan to buy pearls in different colors to make jewelry. As a secondary activity, she also sells brooms and various other items.  

She plans to use her profits to pay the interest on her loan, bolster her savings, and provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy pearls to make jewelry, and brooms and other items.

loans.name: Brigido Jose

texts.es: Brigido es casado ha procreado tres hijos, de los cuales dos son independientes y mayores de edad, uno de ellos habita en su casa, Brigido trabaja como ingeniero en obras civiles desempeñándose como supervisor, Solicita su quinto crédito para continuar con el mejoramiento de vivienda, esta vez desea terminar de construir un cuarto anexo a su casa, que le permitirá brindar a su familia mayor comodidad y privacidad. Cabe señalar que con los préstamos financiados con AFODENIC ha venido mejorando su casa de habitación, realizando anexos, remodelación y pintura de la misma para mejor presentación.
texts.en:
Brigido is married and has three children; two of them are independent adults and one lives with him.  Brigido works as a civil engineer and supervisor of contractor projects.
This is his fifth loan request to continue working on home improvements. This time he wishes to finish building a room addition to his house, which will bring greater comfort and privacy to his family.
It is worth noting that with loans financed through AFODENIC he has been able to make improvements to his home with room additions, remodeling and painting in order to improve its appearance.

loans.use: to buy materials such as iron, cement, sand and blocks.

loans.name: Estefano Marcelo

texts.es: Estéfano tiene 30 años estado civil soltero ,no tiene hijos ,Estefano cuenta que comenzó trabajando como ayudante de un comerciante de pescado y marisco al darse cuenta que la rentabilidad del negocio era bueno ,tomo la decisión de montarse su propio negocio de venta de pescado el trabaja de lunes a viernes de 6:00am hasta 13:00pm. Su sueño es lograr ser un distribuidor de pescado y vender a los hoteles y restaurante más importante .Con el préstamo el va a comprar pescados
texts.en: Estéfano is 30 years old, single, and does not have any children. He says that he started working as an assistant to a fish and shellfish merchant and it made him realize this was a profitable business. He decided to start his own fish-selling business. He works from Monday to Friday from 6:00 am to 1:00 pm. His dream is to become a fish distributor and to sell to more important hotels and restaurants. He will buy fish with this loan.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Merlyn Del Socorro

texts.es: Merlyn trabaja como contadora auxiliar en una empresa de transporte desde hace tres años, su esposo labora como contratista de proyecto, tienen tres hijos de los cuales uno está a su cargo quien cursa la escuela secundaria gracias a su empleo y los ingresos de su esposo ha podido con los gastos de colegio y del hogar de sus hijos que ahora dos de ellos ya son independientes, ella se propuso a reparar su casa, por esta razón solicita apoyo crediticio en esta ocasión  desea realizar un cuarto para que su hijo pueda tener privacidad, para levantar la construcción necesitara comprar 20 bolsas de cemento, arena, 400 bloques, hierro y zinc ya que sus planes a futuros es tener su casa en buenas condiciones para que sus hijos tengan una casa digna obtenida con el esfuerzo de su madre y padre.
texts.en:
Merlyn has worked for the past three years at a transportation company as a bookkeeper.  Her husband is a construction worker. They have three children, and one of who remains in their care attends high school.  

Thanks to her husband’s job and income, she has been able to pay for her children's cost of education and household expenses.  Two of her children are now independent.

Merlyn has set out to fix her house and it is why she requests the aid of a loan.  This time around, she plans to build a room for her son’s privacy.  To build the room she will need to buy 20 bags of cement, sand, 400 blocks, iron and zinc.  Also given that for the future, she wants to keep her house in good conditions so that her children can have a dignified house, built by their parent's hard work.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of cement, sand, 400 blocks, iron and zinc.

loans.name: Magdalena Guadalupe

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Guerra de Los Sexos se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar vive la señora Magdalena, tiene 35 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 16 y 6 años de edad, los  dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Ella vive en la casa de la mamá.

Doña Magdalena para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica al comercio,  tiene un pequeño local en la casa de sus mamá en el cual vende ropa  y de productos de plásticos, en su local sus clientes encuentran de todo, platos, cucharas, vasos, tarrinas, entre otras cosas, la ropa ella vende en su local y también sale a  ofrecer a sus clientes ya que de esta forma vende mucho mas, lo que es ropa las deja a crédito y cobra por semana,  los productos de plástico vende al contado. Tiene más de 8 años con su negocio el cual le permite sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo, vasos, platos y otros productos de plásticos. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado a través de los créditos.
 
Sus sueños tener un local y una casa propia.
texts.en:
The "Guerra de los Sexos" (War of the Sexes) communal bank meets every two weeks in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known for being a commercial center, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and for the rich historical culture that its mountains enclose. 

Magdalena lives here. She is 35 years old and divorced, but has three children ages 17, 16 and 6. The two eldest go to high school and the youngest goes to primary school. She lives in her mother's house. 

Magdalena has a sales business so that she can raise her children. She has a small shop in her mother's house, where she sells clothing, and plastic products. Customers find find some of everything in her shop: plates, spoons, glasses, containers, and other products. She sells the clothing in her shop, and also goes out to offer it to her customers, as this way she sells a great deal more. 

She extends credit for purchase of the clothing, and collects weekly. She sells the plastic products for cash. She has more than a years with her business, and it allows her to help her children get ahead in life. This loan is for the purchase of clothing of all kinds, glasses, plates and other plastic products.

She has been in the communal bank for three years, and likes it because of the help they have given her through the loans. Her dream is to have a shop and her own house.

loans.use: To buy clothing, glasses, plates and other plastic products.

loans.name: María Mariuxi

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Guerra de Los Sexos se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar vive la señorita María, tiene 22 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres, tiene dos hermanos menores que estudian en colegio.

Ella  con la finalidad de ayudar a sus padres y a sus hermanos se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja cuatro días de la semana en los momentos que ella esta desocupada o que sus clientes necesitan algo les vende en su casa,  deja a crédito y cobra por semana o por quincena de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Cada quince o al fin de mes se va  Guayaquil a comprar su mercadería,  lleva más de tres años con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.

Este crédito es para ir a Guayaquil a comprar ropa de todo tipo. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado a través de los créditos.
 
Sus sueños tener un local propio y seguir ayudando a sus padres y hermanos.
texts.en:
The Guerra de los Sexos community bank meets every fifteen days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for being a commercial area, for the traditional feasts of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the rich cultural history contained in its mountains.  

Maria lives in this place.  She is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents and two younger brothers who are in high school.  With the aim of helping her parents and brothers, she works selling all types of clothing.  She sells door to door and works four days a week.  During times she is unoccupied or when her customers need something she sells to them at their home.  She takes credit and collects each week or every two weeks according to her customer's wishes.  Every fifteenth or at the end of the month, she goes to Guayaquil to purchase her merchandise.  She has had this business for more than three years and it allows her to get ahead.

This loan will allow her to go to Guayaquil to purchase all types of clothing.  She has been a member of the community bank for three years and she likes it because of the help it has given her with the loans.  Her dreams are to have her own store and to continue helping her parents and brothers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Dolores Geoconda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Guerra de Los Sexos se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 14 y 12 años que estudian en colegio. El marido es empleado público.
 
Ella es una mujer que le gusta valerse por ella misma y ganar sus propios recursos para poderles dar lo mejor a sus hijos,  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días de la semana más que todo en horas de la mañana ya que a esa hora sus hijos están en clases, también   vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, su mercadería la deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lleva 12 años con  este negocio y la mercadería la compra en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita.

Este crédito es para ir a Guayaquil a comprar pantalones, camisas, ropa de niños, entre otras prendas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es unido y responsable.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Guerra de los Sexos" (War of the Sexes) communal bank meets every two weeks in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known for being a commercial center, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and for the rich historical culture that its mountains enclose.

Dolores lives here. She is 32 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children ages 14 and 12 who go to high school. Her husband is a public employee. 

She is a woman who likes to fend for herself and earn her own income so that she can give the best to her children. She sells clothing of all kinds, and her method of sale is door-to-door. She works three days a week, especially in the morning hours, as at that time her children are in school. She also sells from her home, where her most regular customers come. 

She sells her merchandise on credit and collects weekly. She has been in this business for 12 years and buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to. This loan is so that she can go to Guayaquil to buy pants, shirts, children's clothing and other articles of clothing. 

She has been with the communal bank since the beginning, and likes it because the group is close-knit and responsible. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, children's clothing and other articles of clothing.

loans.name: Reyita Jaqueline

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Guerra de Los Sexos se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar vive la señora Reyita, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad y el menor tiene 13 años el mismo que estudia en colegio y es el que aun vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Reyita al igual que su esposo se dedican al comercio, venden ropa de todo tipo, ellos de tres a cuatros días por semana se desplazan a los campos cercanos lugares donde tienen muy buena clientela  ya que les dan facilidades de pago, dejan a crédito y cobran por semana, ella lleva cuatro años acompañando a su marido en sus ventas aunque él ya tiene muchos años mas dedicado al comercio, trabajo con el cual saca adelante a su familia de una forma honrada.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, ropa de niños, entre otras prendas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ellos pueden comprar más barato y esto le deja  más ganancias.

Su sueño es comprar un carro para trasladarse a más lugares a vender sus prendas.
texts.en:
The “Guerra de los Sexos” (War of the Sexes) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place noted for being very commercial, for its traditional festival of Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the rich historical culture surrounded by its mountains.

Reyita, 42, lives here.  She’s married and has four children, three adults and a 13-year-old who is attending school and still lives with her. Her husband’s a merchant.

Reyita like her husband is a merchant.  They sell all types of clothes.  They head out to nearby fields three or four days a week where they have a very good clientele because they offer good payment plans; they sell on credit and collect weekly payments.  She’s been going along with her husband to sell for four years although he has many years’ experience in commerce being the way he moves his family forward in an honest way.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts and children’s clothes, among others.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and likes it because she’s able to use the loans to buy for lower prices which yields her higher profits.  Her dream is to buy a car to be able to go to other places to sell her clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Marly Benilda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Guerra de Los Sexos se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar vive la señora Marly, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 14 y 3 años de edad, la mayor estudia en colegio. Su esposo es taxista.

Ella además de ser una buena madre y ama de casa se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño local en el cual vende telas por pacas y ropa de todo tipo, entrega sus productos a comerciantes que luego los venden al menudeo en diversos lugares, ella también entrega en algunos talleres de costura, en lo que se refiere a la ropa ella sale por su localidad a entregar a sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, además de esto en las temporadas navideñas vende adornos y nacimientos que tienen mucha salida en esta época del año. Compra sus productos en Guayaquil y Quito dos veces por mes, lleva más de 4 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar telas y ropa de todo tipo. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los créditos ya que estos le ayudan mucho.
 
Su meta es tener un almacén más grande y bien estructurado.
texts.en:
The "Guerra de los Sexos" (War of the Sexes) communal bank meets every two weeks in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known for being a commercial center, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and for the rich historical culture that its mountains enclose.

Marly lives here. She is 39 years old, married, and has two children ages 14 and 3. The eldest goes to high school. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Besides being a good mother and housewife, she has a business. She has a small shop where she sells fabric by the bale, as well as clothing of all kinds. 

She delivers her products to merchants who then sell them at retail in various places. She also delivers to a few sewing workshop. With regard to the clothing, she goes around her town to deliver to her customers. She works every day from 8 AM to 6 PM. 

In addition to this, at Christmas time she sells decorations and nativity scenes, which sell very well at this time of year. She buys her products in Guayaquil and Quito two times a month. She has been in her business for more than four years and it is going very well.

This loan is to buy fabric, as well as clothing of all kinds. She is a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because of the loans, as these help her a great deal. Her goal is to have a larger and well-organized store.

loans.use: To buy fabric and clothing.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 21, 20, 19 y 14 años de edad, todos viven en su casa y la menor de ellos  estudia en colegio. Su marido es chofer profesional.

Doña María para ganar algo propio y con esto poder ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa, sandalias y zapatos de niños, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, sale dos a tres días por semana a recorrer por toda la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos y todos los días vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil y Huaquillas cada vez que necesita. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien, por lo general lo que más vende son prendas de damas.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 7 años  y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez aumenta su negocio. 

Sus sueños tener bien arreglada su casa con todas las comodidades.
texts.en:
The “Bienestar y Progreso” (Wellbeing and Progress) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Colorado in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renown both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

María, 40, lives here.  She’s married and has four children who are 21, 20, 19 and 14 years of age; they all live at home and her youngest daughter attends school.  Her husband is a professional chauffeur.

In order to earn her own income and be able to help with household expenses, she sells clothes, sandals and children’s shoes door-to-door.  She goes out three days a week throughout the city offering her products and also sells from home every day where her best-known customers come by.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and Huaquillas as needed.  She’s been in business 8 years and has done very well.  In general, what she sells the most is women’s clothes.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.   She’s been in the communal bank for 7 years and likes it because she’s able to expand the business each time with the loans.  Her dream is to have a nice house with all the comforts.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Irene Jaqueline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí vive la señorita Irene, tiene 37 años  de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del banco  y le gusta porque son muy unidas en el grupo.

Ella trabaja en una institución pública de lunes a viernes y también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo para lo cual  tiene un local en su casa, mientras ella está trabajando tiene una persona encargada de atender su negocio, en su lugar de trabajo también les vende a sus compañeras las mismas que son sus mejores clientes. Ella  deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería se la envían desde New York por lo cual sus clientes cada vez que llega mercadería le piden que les muestre sus productos. Lleva tres años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas y ropa de niños que es lo que más vende.
 
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Bienestar y Progreso” (Wellbeing and Progress) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Colorado in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renown both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Irene, 37, lives here.  She’s single and lives with her parents.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and she’s its treasurer; she likes it because they are very united in the group.

She’s employed at a public institution from Mondays to Fridays but in addition to this she also sells all types of clothes; she has a space set aside at home to do so.  While she’s at her job, she employs a person who takes care of her business.  She also sells to her coworkers who are her best customers.  She sells on credit and collects payments bi-weekly.  Her merchandise is sent to her from New York which is why her customers ask her to show them her products as soon as they arrive.  She’s been in business three years and does very well.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts and children’s clothes which are what she sells the most.  Her dream is to continue working and increasing her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mercedes Migdalia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija de 18 años que estudia en colegio. Ella vive en casa de sus padres.
 
Doña Mercedes trabaja de secretaria y contadora en una cooperativa de taxis, y  también es socia de la misma ya que tiene un taxi propio que está afiliado a la misma cooperativa y realiza recorridos en la ciudad de Manta, este taxi lo hace conducir por una persona a quien ella le paga un sueldo mensual, en  la actualidad necesita del crédito para realizar algunos arreglos  a su taxi con la finalidad de ofrecer un mejor servicio, tiene siete años con su taxi el cual le permite darle lo mejor a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar llantas y varios  repuestos para mejorar el taxi. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha podido ir pagando su carro.
 
Su sueño es que su hija termine sus estudios y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Bienestar y Progreso" [Welfare and Progress] meets every fortnight in Colorado, in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich pre colonial culture and its craftwork which is recognized nationally and internationally. It's the place of the famous hats made of toquilla straw plants.   

This is where Mercedes lives. She is 49 years old and is a single mother of a 18 years old daughter who is studying in school. She lives with her parents. Mercedes works as a secretary and bookkeeper in a taxi cooperative. She is also a member of it because she has her own taxi affiliated to the cooperative and does routes in the city of Manta. This taxi is driven by a person to who she pays a monthly salary. 

Currently, she needs a loan to make some fixings in her taxi in order to provide a better service. She has had the taxi for seven years, which allows her to give the best to his daughter. This loan is to buy tires and several spare parts to improve the taxi. 

She is in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because she has been able to pay her car with the loans. Her dream is for her daughter to finish her studies and be a great professional.

loans.use: to buy tires and several spare parts.

loans.name: Karina Mariuxi

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Karina, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  9 y 8 años que estudian en la escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas, cortinas y varios productos más, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja 4 días de la semana, sale a recorrer  por toda la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja a crédito y cobra cada sábado. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear para ir Guayaquil a comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 8 años  y le gusta porque con el primer crédito  empezó su negocio por lo cual está muy agradecida.
 
Su sueño es darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Bienestar y Progreso” (Wellbeing and Progress) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Colorado in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renown both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Karina, 31, lives here.  She’s married and has two children who are 9 and 8 years of age and attend school. Her husband is a merchant.

She is a great housewife who is also a merchant in order to help cover household expenses.  She sells all types of clothes, sheets, curtains and various other products door-to-door.  She works four days a week throughout the city offering her wares to customers and she also sells at home where her best-known customers come by.  She sells on credit and collects every Saturday.  She’s been in this activity 8 years and does very well.

She will use this loan to go to Guayaquil to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank for 8 years and likes it because she started her business with the first loan for which she’s very grateful.  Her dream is to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Momela Group

texts.en:
Salma, 38, is a single mother with four children, two of whom are in school. The other two are independent adults. She has had a restaurant business for five years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily, and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.   She used the previous loans to purchase a plot of land, liters of cooking oil, sacks of rice, and wheat flour. She also used them to pay for school fees and household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. Salma hopes for a loan to increase her restaurant food items and clear the outstanding debt on her land.  Her dream is to one day be able to build a house and provide a better education for her children.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Momela, which totals 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her restaurant food items and clear the outstanding debt on her land.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred, a 37 year old store owner, is married to Serafin, a tricycle driver and manager of their welding shop as well as village treasurer. Their marriage is gifted with three children.

Mildred’s store has been a big help in their family, as each week she can earn a gross income of at least PHP 3,000, budgeting that income to support the studies of her eldest child, whose nursing course is very expensive, and for the educational needs of her other two children. Some of the earnings are also used to maintain their corn and rice farming business.

Mildred is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 as additional capital with which she will buy more stock to offer in her store. The said amount will make her store profitable, and hopefully enable her to convert it into a grocery store. In this way, she can provide for the immediate needs of the people in the community and make it more convenient for them because they will not have to go to the market just to acquire their basic requirements.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto tiene 30 años estado civil soltero no tiene hijo. El nos cuenta que tan solo comenzó  armando por partes 2 computadoras y después armadas las vendió y vio que le resulto bueno .El seguía comprando piezas de una computadora las armaba y la vende mejor le resulta comprar en Guayaquil pues es más barato  .Pues el quiere tener  su negocio de ventas de computadoras. Su sueño es abrir locales en Quevedo y venderlas a otras ciudades quiere ser un distribuidor de computadoras . Con el préstamo él quiere comprar: discos duros, monitor teclado, etc.
texts.en:
Roberto, 30, is single and has no children.  He says he began only putting together parts for two computers and later sold them, and saw that it turned out well for him.  He continued buying computer parts, putting them together, and selling.  It's better for him to buy parts in Guayaquil because it's cheaper.

He wants to have a business selling computers.  His dream is to open shops in Quevedo and sell them to other cities.  He wants to be a computer distributor.

With the loan he wants to buy hard drives, monitors, keyboards, etc.

loans.use: to buy hard drives, monitors, keyboards, etc.

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es: Doña Balvina es  originaria de la comunidad San Antonio  Actualmente tiene 54 años de edad, ella desde hace 17 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales (cerdos) y como actividad secundaria se dedica al bordado de trajes típicos, es así como ella ha logrado ayudar a su familia, agradece a kiva la ayuda que le han brindado ya que tiene varios crédito trabajados y no a caído en mora, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de marranos para la crianza, y para la compra de materia prima para la confección de tejidos.
texts.en: Balvina is native of the San Antonio community. She is now 54 years old and she has been engaging in breeding and selling animals (pigs) for 17 years. As an additional activity she embroiders typical suits, and thanks to these two activities she has succeeded in helping her family. She is grateful to Kiva for the help they have given her, as she has already had a few loans, paying them back without defaulting. She is requesting this loan to buy pigs to breed as well as to buy basic materials to wave her fabrics.

loans.use: To buy pigs and materials to weave her fabrics.

loans.name: Fatima Del Socorro

texts.es: La joven Fátima de 37 años, continúa siempre avanzando con su negocio de cosméticos, bisuterías y otros variados, no tiene hijos aun por lo que todos sus ingresos los ha invertido en su oficio y mejoras de su hogar para cuando lleguen sus hijos no les falten nada en un futuro. A Fátima no le faltan ánimos para seguir trabajando y crecer por lo que realiza su onceavo crédito quien agradece el apoyo de AFODENIC y KIVA, esta vez comprara nuevamente productos por catálogos, variedad de ropa, calzado, artículos escolares, accesorios y materiales para seguir haciendo sus prendas de bisuterías, con este ritmo seguirá trabajando para poder cumplir con sus sueños.
texts.en: Fátima, 37 years old, continues to advance herself with her business selling cosmetics, jewelry and other items.  She does not have children yet, so all of her income has been invested in her business and home repairs so that when children arrive in the future they will not want for anything.  Fátima does not lack energy to continue working and growing, so she is requesting her eleventh loan from AFODENIC and Kiva.  This time she will purchase new products from catalogs, a variety of clothing, shoes, school supplies, accessories, and materials to continue making her jewelry pieces.  With this rhythm, she will continue working to be able to accomplish her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase products from catalogs, clothing, shoes, school supplies, accessories, and materials to make jewelry.

loans.name: Juan Bladimir

texts.es: El señor Juan Bladimir, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa que es comerciante de fritanga y tortillas , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Juan desde hace varios años tiene su propia moto Taxi, su fuente de ingresos para darle el pan de cada día a su familia, pero esto no le  genera grandes  ganancias para poder invertir de una sola vez en realizar un anexo a su vivienda en la parte trasera ya que en tiempos de lluvia se pasa toda el agua y no les permite poder lavar ropa. Con la solicitud de este primer crédito va a comprar bloques, cemento, arena, piedrín y zinc para empezar la obra de anexo.
texts.en: Juan Bladimir lives in Ticuantepe with his wife who sells fast-food and tortillas.  His plan for the future is to improve the living conditions.  Juan has had his own mototaxi for several years and it’s his source of income to provide his family’s daily bread but it does not generate sufficient profits to be able to invest once and for all to add on the rear of his house because during the rainy season water comes in and they are unable to clean the house nor to wash clothes.  He’s asking for his first loan to buy concrete blocks, cement, sand, gravel and metal sheeting in order to begin construction on their home.

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, cement, sand, gravel and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Celia Noroska

texts.es: Celia tiene la edad de 35 años, es casada, de profesión abogada, tiene un hijo por quien velar para brindarle lo necesario en su buen desarrollo, como lo es la educación y los estudios; trabaja para una institución privada como coordinadora de proyecto, para ella el hacer mejoras en su vivienda es una prioridad para la comodidad de su hogar y la de su familia, por esta razón ella está optando pon un primer crédito con lo que  comprara pintura y así darle mejor presentación a su casa.
texts.en: Celia, 35, is married and is an attorney.  She has a son in her care and wants to provide what’s necessary like education and schooling so he can develop properly.  She works as a project coordinator in a private firm and her priority is to do some home improvements for her family’s comfort at home.  Because of this, she’s decided on her first loan to buy paint to make her house more attractive..

loans.use: to buy paint.

loans.name: Segundo Balbino

texts.es:
Segundo vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad calurosa, con paisajes muy bellos, se encuentra en la selva peruana y sus pobladores son personas muy hospitalarias y sobre todo alegres. Segundo vive al lado de su esposa y de sus 2 hijos de 16 y 8 años, a quienes ama con todo su corazón y por quienes luchan cada día para poder darles lo mejor y no pasen penurias. Cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus hijos y en ocasiones le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Sarapatera”. Con el apoyo de sus padres estudio la carrera de contabilidad, pero debido a que no encontraba empleo y luego de mucho ahorro logro iniciar su negocio como chofer de mototaxi.

Día a día el sale a trabaja en su mototaxi desde muy temprano, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes al día; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y por los precios cómodos.

Segundo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su mototaxi y poder comprar llantas nuevas, toldo y pintar el vehículo, de esta manera el podrá tener un vehículo en buen estado y así mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” dArle una buena educación a sus hijos y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia”.
texts.en:
Segundo lives in the city of Pucallpa, a hot city with beautiful scenery located in the Peruvian jungle.  Its residents are very hospitable and above all cheerful.  

Segundo lives with his wife and two children who are 16 and 8 years old who he loves with all his heart and for whom they strive daily to provide with the best and keep from want.  When he has any free time available he likes to play soccer with his children very much and occasionally loves eating one of his favorite dishes, the delicious “Sarapatera” [turtle soup].  With his parents’ support he was able to study accounting but because he was unable to find employment and by saving up he was able to start his own business driving a mototaxi.

He heads out to work with his mototaxi very early every day.  He works about 10 hours daily and can serve up to 30 customers per day.  He believes he does well in his business because he’s very kind to customers and because his prices are affordable.

Segundo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to provide general maintenance for his mototaxi and to buy new tires, a new roof and to paint it so that he can have a vehicle in good condition and thus improve his income and continue striving daily to make his greatest dream reality: to provide a good education for his children and to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to improve and service his vehicle.

loans.name: Maylling Del Carmen

texts.es: Maylling es casada se dedica a la costura de ropa, oficio que aprendió de su madre desde la edad de 17 años,  es casada tiene dos hijos quienes están pequeños y ella trabaja hasta altas horas de la noche para poder terminar de hacer los encargos de sus clientes y para cubrir con los gastos de la familia en conjunto con su esposo. Con el crédito solicitado comprara tela y accesorios para hacer uniformes escolares y ejecutivos siendo este su primer crédito con la esperanza de seguir con su labor cotidiana y obtener un poco más de ingresos para respaldar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maylling is married and is a seamstress who produces clothing.  She learned this trade at the age 17 from her mother.  Maylling has two young children and works until the late hours of the evening so that she can complete the orders from her customers.  This enables her to cover the family expenses in conjunction with her husband.  

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fabric and accessories for making both school and executive uniforms.  This will be her first loan and she hopes that it will allow her to continue her daily work so that she can earn a bit more income to support her children.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and accessories for making uniforms.

loans.name: Luisa Lavina

texts.es: Luisa habítate del municipio de Ticuantepe, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad e independientes, ella trabaja para una empresa privada, pero su salario no le da para invertir en la mejora del baño de su vivienda, el crédito lo necesita para comprar azulejos, lavamano, masía, cemento, y una puerta, con el crédito anterior logro poner cerámica a la sala por lo que está muy contenta por los logros que está obteniendo, gracias al apoyo que brinda Afodenic en conjunto con kiva para mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas.
texts.en:
Luisa is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe. Her children are already grown and live independently. Luisa works for a private company, but her salary does not allow her to invest in improvements to the bathroom in her home.

She needs a loan in order to buy tiles, a wash basin, grout, cement, and a door. Her previous loan was used to install ceramic tiles in her living room and she is very pleased that she was able to accomplish this. Luisa is grateful for the support that AFODENIC and Kiva are providing so that people can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tiles, a wash basin, grout, cement, and a door.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of secondhand clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants and shirts for women, men, and children

loans.name: Lazaro Jose

texts.es: Don Lazaro tiene 40 años de edad vive en un departamento muy cercano a Managua, con sus ahorros de trabajos anteriores dio inicio a su negocio vendiendo ropa a domicilio en la zona donde vive poco a poco fue comprando más productos y empezó a viajara a los departamentos para seguir vendiendo y captar mayor clientela. Solcita crédito por primera vez para seguir invirtiendo en ropa en general de dama caballero, niños y sandalias de dama, su esposa también es comerciante de frutas y verduras en el mercado, tienen dos hijos pequeños que cursan la escuela primaria a quienes desean verlos realizados con una carrera profesional, al comienzo de su negocio la mayor dificultad que se le presento fue en la búsqueda de nuevos clientes  así como también la falta de capital para cubrir la demanda. Ahora Lazaro ha crecido con sus propios esfuerzos, para futuro contratara a dos personas para que también salgan a verder a los departamentos y seguir creciendo con su negocio que es el futuro de sus hijos y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Lázaro, 40, lives in a department very close to Managua.  With his savings from previous jobs he started his business selling clothing door-to-door in the area where he lives.  Little by little he bought more products and began to travel to other departments to continue selling and attracting more customers.

He's requesting a loan for the first time to continue investing in general clothing for women, men, and children, and women's sandals.

His wife also sells fruits and vegetables in the market.  They have two small children in elementary school whom they want to see become professionals.

The greatest difficulty he had in his business at first was finding new customers as well as the lack of capital to cover demand.  Now Lázaro has grown through his own efforts.  In the future he'll hire two people who also will go out to the departments to sell.  He'll also continue growing with his business, which is his children's future and his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy sandals and general clothing for women, men, and children

loans.name: Carolina Antonia

texts.es: La señora Carolina, es habitante de un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Managua, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como guarda de seguridad para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen hijos quienes estudian, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, Carolina labora como docente en una escuela pública del sector, el financiamiento lo necesita para  mejorar la parte delantera de la vivienda ya que es bien insegura y en dos ocasiones le han robado las pocas pertenencias que con mucho esfuerzo a logrado adquirir . por esta razón opto por solicitar su primer préstamo para comprar bloques, cemento, arena, hierro, y el pago de la mano de obra, de esa manera le brindara mayor seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carolina lives in a town near the city of Managua with her husband, who works as a security guard to help her with the household expenses.  They have children who are students.  Her plans for the family are to improve their living conditions.  Carolina works as a teacher in a public school in the area.

She needs the loan to improve the front part of her house, which is very insecure, and she has been robbed twice of the few possessions she had managed to acquire with great effort.  This is why she decided to request her first loan to buy concrete blocks, cement, sand, and rebar, and to pay for labor.  This way she'll give her children greater security.

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, cement, sand, and rebar, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Josefa Nuvia

texts.es: Doña Josefa es comerciante, el motivo de su préstamo fue para enriquecer su venta comprando perfumes, ropa nueva, bolsos, cazuelas de cocinas, el crédito vino a hacer la diferencia en su negocio porque ahora tiene más productos y ayuda a mejorar su vida, los desafíos que ha enfrentado son la salud de su hijo menor y el de su hermana quienes se vieron afectados pero ahora están bien gracias a Dios, sus planes a futuro es viajar fuera del país para comprar joyas de plata y venderlas aquí y así obtener mejores ganancias. Adicional a su negocio principal vende carne de res, tiene tres hijos el mayor de 20 años ya trabaja, agradece mucho por el apoyo brindado de Afodenic por medio de KIVA.
texts.en: Mrs. Josefa is a salesperson; her loan is to increase her sales by buying items like perfumes, new clothing, purses, and cooking pans. The loan has made a difference in her business since she has more products to offer and has helped her improve her life. The obstacles that she has had to overcome are the health of her youngest child and that of her sister who were sick but are ‘now doing well, thank God.’ Her future plans are to travel outside of the country to buy silver jewelry and to sell them in her home to have better earnings. Besides her main business, Mrs. Josefa also sells beef. She has three children, and the oldest is 20 years old and has a job. Mrs. Josefa is very grateful for the support given to her by Afodenic through KIVA.

loans.use: buy items like perfumes, new clothing, purses, and cooking pans.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Teresa labora como docente en una  escuela del municipio donde habita, queda un poco lejos de la capital Managua desde hace 22 años, es una persona muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo tiene estabilidad laboral, cuenta con la ayuda del padre de sus hijos son una familia bien unida, con alto espiritu de superacion personal y profesional. Solicita nuevamente crèdito para invertirlo en mejoras de su pequeña vivienda reparando una pared que esta en mal estado y el techo de la cocina. Su mayor sueño en la vida es que sus hijos gozen de salud y que sean personas de vida y que no les falte lo basico en el hogar.
texts.en: Mrs. Teresa Works as an educator in a municipal school where she lives, it’s a bit farther than the capital, Managua. For some 22 years, she has been a beloved member of the school by her coworkers and enjoys work stability. Mrs. Teresa has the support of the father of her children as they are a very united family with great determination to succeed both personally and professionally. She is seeking another loan to invest it to make improvements in her small home to repair a wall that is in a bad state and the roof of her kitchen. Mrs. Teresa’s greatest dream in life is that her children enjoy good health and that they be people who enjoy life and that they never lack anything basic in their home.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, iron, tiles, and zinc.

loans.name: Agustina Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Agustina se desempeña como docente de primaria hace 26 años,  cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos todos mayores de edad, independientes, trabajadores son una familia muy unida y religiosa. Solicita nuevamente apoyo crediticio para comprar material de construcciòn como cemento, arena, bloques, hierro y asi poder construir una habitaciòn con mejores condiciones en su casa, poco a poco ir progresando con la infraestructura de su vivienda ya que de un solo es muy dificil por la baja economia. Su sueño es gozar de salud y que sus hijos sigan en los caminos de Dios.
texts.en: Mrs. Agustina has worked as an educator in a primary school for some 26 years. She has the support of her children; all are adults, independent, hard workers and are a very united and religious family. Mrs. Agustina needs another loan to buy construction materials like cement, sand, cement blocks, and iron to build a room and improve the living conditions in her home. Little by little she has made improvements to the infrastructure of her home since doing it all at once is very difficult due to the bad economy. Mrs. Agustina’s dream is to enjoy good health and that her children follow God’s teachings.

loans.use: buy construction materials like cement, sand, cement blocks, and iron.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.es:
Doña Victorina habita en un municipio lejano a la capital Managua, trabaja como comerciante desde hace 15 años, es una mujer emprendedora que ha luchado por seguir adelante y así ayudar a su familia ya que son de escasos recursos económicos, es muy querida por sus vecinos por ser servicial y sociable en su comunidad, vende tortillas, compra y vende yuca, quequisque, maíz, frijoles; una vez a la semana viaja a Managua a comercializar sus productos de los cuales obtiene su ingreso mensual, solamente tiene una hija quien trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.     
        
Solicita crédito por primera vez para comprar un pequeño terreno y así poder ir construyendo poco a poco su propia vivienda; Sueña con tener un mejor porvenir, que su hija culmine sus estudios universitarios y gozar de salud.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victorina lives in a municipality far from the capital of Managua and has worked as a salesperson for over 15 years. She is a very enterprising woman that has worked hard to get ahead and to help her family since they have limited financial resources. She is beloved by her neighbors for being helpful and social in her community. She sells tortillas, buys and sells yucca, quequisque (a tuber), corn and beans. Once a week Mrs. Victorina travels to Managua to sell her items and gets her monthly income. She only has one daughter that works and helps her with the household expenses.

Mrs. Victorina needs a loan for the first time to buy a small plot of land to keep building her home little by little. She dreams of having a better future and that her daughter finishes her university education and enjoys good health.

loans.use: buy a small plot of land.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun, aged 48, is from Kompong Speu province, Cambodia. He lives there with his wife (shown in the photo) and three single children, while the other two are married and live elsewhere. Bun and his wife are employed in a local factory where bricks are made, to be used in construction. They can earn a decent salary to raise their family. In his present career, Bun works as a wise foreman who directs the work of a group of people. Also, Bun could get a commission on every sale, if he could find more customers for the bricks. Despite his difficulties, Bun aims to educate his three younger children to a higher level of education so that they may have a bright future.

For another source of family income, Bun wants to devote himself to a transportation business in his community, when he has time available from daily work at the brick factory. But he is not able to do this because he lacks a vehicle. For this reason, he is now asking for a loan through HKL and Kiva to purchase a motorcycle, which he will use for a transportation business and for household use, because the family needs transportation. He said that this financial support will be a great help to him, to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle, which he will use for a transportation business and for household use.

loans.name: Jamyansharav

texts.en: Mrs.Jamyansharav is 53 years old and lives with her husband in a small house in Arhangai Province, Mongolia. Her husband, Purevsuren, is 55 years old. He works for construction company as woodman. She started her business of meat retail in rental counter at local market in 2005. She had built closer relationship with customers and has lot of loyal customers of her own. She wants to run meat wholesale in near future. She is modest and hardworking person. She is requesting 3,500,000MNT loan, to purchase meat and cattle to sell in higher price after high season which meat price falls to the lowest of the year finishes.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell with retail mark-up

loans.name: Zef

texts.en:
Zef, a 53-year-old married man, has been in animal husbandry for almost eight years.  He has five children ranging in age from 10 to 28 years old. They all live in a major district in the northwest part of Albania.

Zef has been selling milk to local dairy farms and baby animals to locals. In the past few years his activity has been growing because he has been establishing good rapport with his clients.

Zef's future goal is that with the little savings from his activity he can build a better stable for the animals and finish building the second floor of their family house. For now he is requesting a Kiva loan to build a hay barn because the winters in his region are very snowy.

loans.use: to build a hay barn.

loans.name: Ixoqui'b Ajchac Group

texts.es:
La señora Francisca esta casada, tiene 55 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando, se dedica a la venta de mercería, inicio este negocio con un poco de capital que disponía y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo..

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería para la venta, como es: adornos, telas, perlas, botones, etc. Espera incrementar y surtir su negocio y mejorar sus ventas. Las demas integrantes se dedican al comercio, artesanía y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca is married, is 55 years old, did not have the opportunity to study and she has 8 children of which 2 are studying. She earns her living by selling merchandise. She started this business 6 years ago with the little bit of savings that she had.  She depends on support from her husband who also earns a living through the same work.
She founded a group to request a loan which will be used to buy merchandise such as ornaments, fabrics, beads, buttons, etc. to be sold. She hopes to increase and stock up on goods for her business and improve her sales. The other members earn a living through commerce, handicrafts and raising livestock.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Raul Alfredo

texts.es: Don Raúl tiene 48 años de edad  es asalariado, trabaja como celador en una empresa privada, sus 3 hijos estudian la primaria y la secundaria él desea verlos con una carrera profesional y que sean personas de bien, en la vida ha tenido dificultades en especial el tratar de ampliar su casa para darle mejor comodidad a su familia ya que en un futuro su mayor sueño es poder hacerle un cuarto a cada uno de sus hijos para la comodidad de ellos. En esta ocasión solicita crédito para hacer un cuarto y mejorar las condiciones de la cocina en su vivienda para eso necesitara comprar laminas de zinc, perlines, bloques, cemento, arena y hierro, de esa manera irá cambiando la infraestructura de su hogar con apoyo de créditos.
texts.en: Raúl is 48 years old and makes a living as a security guard for a private company. His three children are in elementary and high school, and he wants to seem them earn a professional degree and become good people. In life, he has had difficulties, in particular trying to expand his home to give his family more comfort. His biggest dream for the future is for all his children to have their own rooms. At this time he is requesting a loan to build a room and improve his home's kitchen, for which he will need to purchase zinc sheets, beams, cinder blocks, cement, sand and iron. In this way he will continue improving his home's infrastructure with support from the loans.

loans.use: to purchase zinc sheets, beams, cinder blocks, cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Marlon Mauricio

texts.es: El joven Marlon de 23 años de edad de familia agricultora quien dio inicio sembrando con sus padres pero ahora, el solo vela por el buen funcionamiento de su cultivo dedicándole un 100% a la agricultura, su esposa siempre desempeñándose como comerciante vendiendo frutas en unos de los mercados de Managua, su único hijo pequeño aun no asiste a la  escuela pero Marlon se está preparando desde ya para su educación y que no le falte nada de lo primordial para su desarrollo. El joven solicita apoyo crediticio número 6 para darle mantenimiento a una manzana de pitahayas comprando, urea, abono, completo e insecticidas para obtener mejores cultivos; la principal dificultad que él ha tenido es que no ha podido crecer por falta de tierra, en un futuro desea comprar un pequeño terreno y así poder sembrar mas pitahaya y piña para obtener mejores ganancias y brindar a su familia una mejor economía.
texts.en:
Marlon, 23, is a young farmer who started planting with his parents but now he’s the only one caring for the crops and spends 100% of his time in agriculture.  His wife works as a merchant selling fruit in one of Managua’s markets.  His only son is still too little to attend school but Marlon is preparing for his education even now so that he won’t lack any essentials needed for his development.

This young man is requesting his 6th loan to provide maintenance for his one manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] of dragon fruit.  He will buy urea, manure, fertilizer and insecticide in order to obtain better crops.  The main difficulty he’s had is that he’s been unable to expand for lack of land.  In future, he’d like to buy a small parcel to plant more dragon fruit and pineapples to earn higher profits and provide better economy for his family.

loans.use: to buy urea, manure, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Elvia Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora Elvia es socia del banco comunal Las Toquilleras, todos sus miembros viven cerca del cantón Sigsig, lugar con hermosas montañas, la mayoría de las  mujeres de este cantón se dedican a los quehaceres de sus hogares, trabajan en la agricultura, crían animales o realizan sombreros de paja toquilla, muchos trabajan en la ciudad, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Elvia tiene 43 años, es casada y fruto de su unión ha conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos, 2 de sus hijos trabajan, le ayudan económicamente y también estudian a distancia, 5 hijos están estudiando en el colegio y su ultimo hijo se en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es un profesional en el volante y trabaja conduciendo una volqueta, la casa en la que viven es de propiedad conyugal.

La Señora Elvia se dedica los quehaceres de su hogar y a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su hogar, cría animales como cerdos, cuyes y pollos los que vende en su comunidad, labora también en el oficio que aprendió de su madre el cual es la realización de sombreros de paja toquilla.
 
Se encuentra realizando el segundo crédito en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y paja toquilla para continuar en esta actividad.

Su sueño es tener un negocio propio como una tienda.
texts.en:
Elvia’s a member of the “Las Toquilleras” (The Straw Hat Makers) communal bank.  All its members live near Sigsig Canton, a place surrounded by beautiful mountains.  Most of the women in this canton are housewives who do their household chores and also work in agriculture, raise animals or make straw hats.  Many work in the city and preserve the culture and traditions of their peoples.

Elvia, 43, is married and has had 8 children.  Two of her children are employed and help out economically and are also enrolled in distance learning programs. Five of her children are attending secondary school and her youngest attends the local elementary school.  Her husband is a professional truck driver; he drives a dump truck.  The house they live in is joint property.

Elvia does her household chores and also works in agriculture growing food for home consumption.  She also raises animals like pigs, guinea pigs and chickens that she sells in her community.  She also works in the occupation she learned from her mother: making straw hats.

She’s in her second loan with the communal bank and will use it to buy chicks and hat-making straw to continue with this activity.  Her dream is to have a business of her own like a store.

loans.use: to buy chicks and straw.

loans.name: Rosa Arcila

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Las Toquilleras, todos sus miembros viven cerca del cantón Sigsig, lugar con hermosas montañas, la mayoría de las  mujeres de este cantón se dedican a los quehaceres de sus hogares, trabajan en la agricultura, crían animales o realizan sombreros de paja toquilla, muchos trabajan en la ciudad, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Rosa tiene 46 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, dos de ellos son casados y viven independientes, uno de sus hijos estudia en la universidad, uno está en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es chofer profesional y labora conduciendo un bus, la casa en la que viven es el resultado del trabajo conyugal.
