Pellumb and his family live in the south of Albania, a district known for its delicious apple fruits. He is married and has one son, 33, who is a soccer player and coach for children ages 15-16 years old. 

For the past eight years, Pellumb has been planting and taking care of apple orchards. He owns a few “dynyms” of such land. Throughout the years, the growth in clientele has been at a steady pace and the results make Pellumb happy. The increase in earnings that he’s been experiencing in these recent years has made him happier :). His clients are store owners, and his products are sold within the country and also in neighboring countries.

To maintain production quantity and quality, Pellumb is seeking a Kiva loan to buy pesticides. He is hopeful that lenders will support him.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for his apple orchards

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn is involved in rice farming as well as hog-raising for her livelihood. She is 39 years old and responsible for three teen-aged children who are attending school. Her priority is to educate all of her children up to college and provide them basic living needs. She is very industrious and always keeps herself busy with her current businesses because she wants to achieve goals and secure her family. Her effort has been a great help to her family and her husband, who devotes himself to a fishing business.

Due to the lack of vehicle to transport fish to the marketplace, Vorn is now requesting a loan through HKL to purchase a motorcycle. She hopes for great changes in their present businesses through the help of the loan. She wishes to be a successful entrepreneur in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to transport fish to the marketplace.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan is an industrious farmer, raising her family that is comprised of four members in a small village of Kompong Speu province. She grows rice during the rainy season lasting from May to October, while her husband devotes himself to a construction business to provide for his family. In the dry season, Phan usually finds other supplementary businesses for additional income, such as raising piglets or poultry. 

Phan aims to sustain her business to earn better yields so that she will be able to satisfy her living needs and save money for sending her two children to a good college after they finish high school. In the same manner, Phan’s husband strives to work hard and seeks ways to achieve their dreams. He plans to operate a motorcycle transportation business, but they have insufficient funds to buy a motorcycle. That is why Phan is requesting a loan in the sum of $600 to purchase a motorcycle, which will be used by her husband for the new transportation business. With the loan, Phan mentioned that she will be able to improve her family's status of living and she hopes to lift her family out of poverty someday as she and her husband strive to work hard.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle, which will be used by her husband for a transportation business.

loans.name: Dom

texts.en: Dom is a widower and a father of four single children. He is raising his children in the small village of Kompong Speu province. Dom is the operator of a transportation business in his community, besides having a rice farming business. He has been doing this for almost 20 years, earning an average income of 8,000 KHR per day. He wants earn more income to secure his family financially, but his old motorcycle breaks frequently, which affects his operation and decreases his income. For this reason, Dom sold his motorcycle and decided to seek a loan in the amount of $600 to purchase a new one. This will enable him to keep improving his business for the overall well-being of his family. In the future, he hopes that he can have extra plots of farmland and send some of his children to be educated at a good college.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for a transportation business.

loans.name: Suos

texts.en:
Suos is 54 years old, married and the mother of five grown-up children. She has tried very hard to feed the family since she became a widow due to family conflicts and unavoidable circumstances. Suos pursues her farming business to generate the major source of income for her family. Though she earns a small income from this business, she is proud to have the support her children, who always help with most of the maintenance at the rice field. Currently, three of her children are married.

At the moment, Suos is in need of necessary farming supplies to spread on her rice crops in order to ensure proper growth. Due to insufficient funds, she is borrowing a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase fertilizer for good nutrition of her crop. She is hoping that someday, she will be a successful entrepreneur in her community and she can afford to send her two younger children to a good university. She is very thankful to all kind lenders for the support of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Flor Lastenia

texts.es: Flor de 39 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos menores de edad, quienes dependen por completo de ella, ya que ellas es madre soltera y debe sacar adelante a su familia con sus esfuerzos. Flor realiza un trabajo bastante duro el cual es la siembra de frijoles y maíz en una parcela que alquila para realizar esta actividad, luego de sembrar las semillas ella se dedica a cuidar las matas para posteriormente obtener los granos básicos para comercializar. Flor solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar semillas de maíz y frijoles para sembrar y así aumentar su producción de granos básicos y teniendo fe en que sus ventas crecerán.
texts.en:
Flor is 39 years old and lives with her three young children who are completely dependent on her. Since she is a single mother, Flor gives her best effort to move her family forward. She works hard planting beans and corn on a parcel of land that she rents for her business. After the seeds are sown, Flor cares for the plants that will eventually bear basic grains that she can sell.

Flor is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy corn and bean seeds to plant. This will increase her production of basic grains. Flor has faith that her sales will increase.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds for planting.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria trabajó durante más de 14 años en una repostería donde alcanzó a adquirir una gran experiencia en la actividad, pero debido a que el salario que allí estaba recibiendo no era suficiente para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, pues es madre soltera cabeza de hogar de su hijo de 18 años, ha decidido montar su propio negocio. Es así como ahora busca un préstamo para comprar un horno, moldes, nevera, batidora, y otras herramientas más los insumos necesarios para montar su propia repostería.

De esta manera aspira a mejorar los ingresos que genera para su hogar y así la calidad de vida de su hijo pueda mejorar considerablemente.
texts.en:
Luz Maria worked in a cake shop for over 14 years where she gained extensive experience. However her salary was not sufficient to sustain her living expenses as she is a single mother and the main caretaker of her 18 year old son. Therefore she has decided to start her own business. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy an oven, baking tins, refrigerator, mixer and other equipment as well as the necessary supplies to start her own cake shop. 

This is how she is aspiring to increase the income she generates for her home and in this way significantly improving her son’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an oven, baking tins, refrigerator, mixer and other equipment as well as the necessary supplies to start her own cake shop.

loans.name: Chy

texts.en:
Chy is 28 years old and lives in Kampong Chhnang province. She has a common law relationship with her spouse and has been blessed with two school-aged children. She manages her own farmland by planting rice both for daily food and for sale. For additional income, she is employed in the local garment industry, when she has her farm work done in each season. Chy has been a seamstress for more than six years. Despite her hardships, Chy hopes to meet the needs of her family and educate her two children.

Chy wants to operate a retail business, selling fruit in her neighborhood. With this new business, she is hoping for more income and more time to be with her family, rather than working in the factory for 8-10 hours each day. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to invest in purchasing stock of fruit for selling. She believes that the loan will make it possible for her to improve her status of living.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing stock of fruit for resale.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Kang is 25 years old and the mother of two young children, currently residing in Kompong Speu province. Raising and educating her two children to be good citizens are her responsibilities and obligations; she has to have them done in life. Kang and her husband help each other to manage their family-owned businesses to achieve their dreams. Kang cultivates her farmland by planting rice, with constant support from her spouse each season, while his primary business is to sell charcoal from his trailer. 

They have aimed to increase their yields and income so that they can afford to send their children to school soon in the upcoming year. In connection with this, Kang would like to make improvements in her rice farming business to ensure a high production. Therefore, she is taking out a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 KHR for farming purposes. With the loan, she will be able to pay for labor costs, and to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for growing her rice crop. She is hoping to have a fruitful harvest and thereby make a higher income.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs, and purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for growing her rice crop.

loans.name: Sokhim's Group

texts.en:
Sokhim, a hardworking farmer from Tbaung Khmum district of Cambodia, is the mother of three daughters who currently are helping the family's business and with household chores. To deal with daily expenses in term of food and other basic needs, Sokhim grows sugarcane and her husband works as a driver. From her current business, she is able to earn about 15,800 KHR per day. 

In a group of four members, Sokhim and one of her co-members are the fourth-time borrowers, another one is a fifth-time borrower, and the remaining one is a newly-joined client. Sokhim has wisely managed her past loans and upgraded her standard of living gradually. Now, three of her group members, including her, are seeking 1,200,000 KHR each, while the fourth fellow group member is seeking 1,000,000 KHR. As a group leader, Sokhim's loan portion will be used to buy fertilizer to boost her sugarcane plantation. She hopes to grow her cash-crop on time so that she can receive more yield and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to boost her sugarcane plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Nancy Viviana

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy forma parte del banco comunal Sociedad 12 de Abril, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, ciudad que tiene una arquitectura colonial y  moderna, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen viva su cultura y tradiciones.
La Señora Nancy tiene 23 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Ella labora diariamente en la venta de mariscos en un mercado de la ciudad, actividad que la desempeña hace 3 años y gracias a su carisma ha logrado tener una clientela selecta, este trabajo le da el espacio para poder cuidar de sus hijos quienes aun son pequeños.
 
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de una gran variedad de mariscos para su negocio y la cancelación de dicho crédito lo ha realizado en las fechas correspondientes sin dificultad. Su nuevo crédito también lo va a invertir comprando mariscos.

El banco comunal le gusta porque es una manera rápida de poder tener capital para su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy belongs to the "12 de Abril" communal bank.  She lives in Cuenca, a city that's been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity since December, 1999.  It's a city with colonial and modern architecture.  It's residents are kind, pleasant and still preserve their culture and traditions.

Nancy's 23-years-old and the single mother of two children who are 5 and 3 years old.  Her oldest daughter goes to the local elementary school.  Nancy's house is hers.  She works daily selling seafood in a city market, an activity she's been in for three years and that thanks to her charisma has led to having a select clientele.  This work gives her time to care for her children who are still little.

She used the money from her previous loan to buy a large selection of seafood for her business and repaid said loan on time and with no difficulties.  She will also use her new loan to buy seafood.  She likes her communal bank because it's a quick way to get business capital.

loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña  maría auxiliadora de 65 años de edad, desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura en terreno propio, en un comienzo tuvo dificultades con los financiamientos pero logro vencer los obstáculos demostrando buen cumplimiento con todos sus pagos, su esposo trabaja como conductor de buses, sus hijos todos mayores de edad y le apoyan económicamente para sus gastos primordiales, solicita un sexto crédito para comprar urea abono, insecticida y completo, para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de piña, su sueño es poder sembrar otras manzanas para generar mayor ingresos y descansar un poco, ya que a su edad es mas cansado la labor de la siembra.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora is 65 years old.  Since she was very young, she has worked as a farmer on her own land.  At the beginning, she had difficulties with her loans, but she succeeded in overcoming those obstacles and has demonstrated compliance with all of her payments.  Her husband works as a bus driver.  Her children are adults who help financially support her basic expenses.  

She is requesting a sixth loan to purchase urea, insecticide, and fertilizer to maintain her pineapple crop.  Her dream is to be able to plant other plots to generate more income and rest a little, since at her age working in the field is very tiring.

loans.use: to purchase urea, insecticide, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of farm labor.

loans.name: Makongo Kk Group

texts.en:
Justina, who is in her early 30's, is married and has three children who go to school.  She has been running her business selling charcoal and vitumbua (puff rice cake) for six years now.  She works from 4 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily, and she is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy more rice for making more vitumbua (puff rice cake) and to cover household expenses, and she has paid back her loan successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and rice.  Her dream is to one day be able to build a house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Makongo KK," which has 12 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of  charcoal and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics, sewing machines, thread in different colors, and other pieces of equipment.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Amor Y Paz se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, localidad donde su gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos.

En este lugar vive la  señora María, tiene 56 años, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 7 hijos, pero uno murió en un accidente, todos sus hijos son mayores de edad y dos de ellos aun viven con ella los mismos que junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura. 

Doña para obtener sus propios ingresos hace mas de 15 años puso una pequeña tienda en su casa, la misma y que con el paso del tiempo ha ido mejorándola y surtiéndola cada día mas, en la actualidad además de víveres  también vende algunos medicamentos y tarjetas telefónicas que también le dejan buenas ganancias. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00, trabaja sola y en ciertas ocasiones con la ayuda de sus esposo y sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar arroz, azúcar y otros productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda. Es socia fundadora del Banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado en todo el tiempo que está en el banco.
 
Sus sueños son comprar un carro para movilizarse.
texts.en:
The Amor Y Paz community bank meets every fifteen days in the Calderón parish of the city of Portoviejo.  There people work in agriculture, raising animals, and product sales.

María is 56 years old, married, and had seven children.  One of her children died in an accident and the rest are adults.  Two of them live with her and along with her husband, work in agriculture.

In order to earn her own income, more than 15 years ago she put a small store in her home.  With time, she has been improving it and stocking it more every day.  Currently, along with groceries, she also sells some medicines and telephone cards, which also earn her a good profit.  She works every day from 6:00am until 10:00pm.  She works alone, but sometimes her husband or children will help.

She will use this loan to purchase rice, sugar, and other basic products to stock her store.  She is the founding member of the community bank and she likes it for the help it has provided her.

Her dream is to purchase a car to be able to get around.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and other basic products.

loans.name: Johana Group

texts.es: Grupo formados por tres socias exitosas una de ellas es Johana que comenzó vendiendo cigarrillos, caramelos, ambulante actualmente vende enchiladas, tacos, carne asada gaseosas en su domicilio esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 8 años sus sueños es conseguir un toldo para brindar mejor atención a sus clientes. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como arroz, aceite, frijoles, carne de pollo, carne de res, legumbre. Doña Nubia tiene una venta de  fritanga y Agustina tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The group consists of three successful business partners. One of them is Johana who started as a street vendor selling cigarettes and candy. Currently she sells enchiladas, tacos, grilled meat and soda out of her home. She has been working out of her home for the past eight years. Her dream is to buy a store awning in order to provide better service for her customers. 

She will invest this loan in buying staples such as rice, oil, beans, chicken, beef and vegetables. 

Nubia runs a small restaurant and Agustina runs a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy staples such as rice, oil, beans, sugar, beef, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Yeb

texts.en:
Yeb, 45, lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor District of Pursat Province, Cambodia. He has four children, all of whom are dependent on him and are in school. 

Rice farming on 1.5 hectares area of farmland is the main source of the family’s income.  Yeb has been in this for twenty-five years. To add more income for the family, he also buys cows to resell. The current business earns him approximately US $11 per day, and he can save about US $6 each day after daily expenses. Low crop yield because of destruction by insects is the main challenge for his rice paddy. 

Yeb is in his first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now he is requesting a loan of US $1010. Yeb is going to utilize this loan to buy fertilizer for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying cows to resell. Yeb hopes this loan will enable him to grow his rice fruitfully and timely so as to improve his standard of living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farmland and cows to resell.

loans.name: Yusupjon

texts.ru: Юсупчон  мужчина в возрасте  56 лет.   Женат, имеет 3 детей.   Сам работает на железнодорожной станции, а жена преподаватель. Более 18 лет это семья дополнительно  занимается откормом скота.  В наличии имеет около 20 голов мелко рогатого скота.   Юсупчон   содержит скот  на пастбище.  Он  очень хорошо разбирается в преимуществах  своего дела.  Знает когда закупать и продавать скот.  Основной доход семьи от животноводства, поэтому вся семья работает не покладая рук.   Юсупчон  на полученный кредит хочет купить скот и увеличить свое стадо.   Заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Yusupjon is a 56 year-old man.  He is married and has three children.  He works at a railroad station, and his wife is a teacher.  The family has been additionally involved in fattening up livestock for over 18 years.  They have about 20 heads of small livestock.  Yusupjon keeps the livestock at a pasture.  He knows the advantages of his business well.  He knows when to buy and sell livestock.  The family's primary income comes from animal husbandry, and this is why the whole family works without putting their hands down.  Yusupjon wants to use this loan to buy livestock and increase his herd.  He is grateful to Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy livestock and increase his herd

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Amor Y Paz se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Calderón de la  ciudad de Portoviejo, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Ana se dedica junto a su esposo al comercio, ellos venden productos agrícolas, tamarindo cocinado por libras, maní en grano y molido, achiote y otros productos más, al por mayor y menor. Trabajan todos los días de 4 h00 hasta las 15h00, ellos además de vender por la zona en la que viven también se desplaza a otras ciudades como: Manta, Portoviejo y Quevedo, lugares donde venden a muy buen precio sus productos. Los productos para la venta los compran a los agricultores de la zona, luego ella Los procesa y después los llevan a entregar.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar maní, tamarindo, achiote y otros productos que vende. Está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta por los beneficios que reciben del banco. 

Su meta es comprar un carro para realizar sus ventas con más comodidad.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Amor y Paz" meets every fifteen days in the parish of Calderón in the city of Portoviejo. In this area, the people make a living in agriculture, raising animals and selling their products. 

Here Ana lives, who is 48 years old and married. She has three children from this relationship who are of independent age, two of whom still live with her. Her husband is a merchant. Ana works together with her husband as a merchant. They sell agricultural products including cooked tamarind by the pound, peanuts whole and ground, achiote and other products at wholesale and retail prices. She works everyday from 4:00 am until 3:00 pm. In addition to selling in the area where they live, they also travel to other cities including Manta, Portoviejo and Quevedo, places which they sell their products at a very good prices. They buy their products from farmers in the area, process them and then deliver them to sell. 

This credit will be used to buy peanuts, tamarind and achiote, in addition to other products that she sells. She has been a part of this Communal Bank since it began and likes it because of the benefits they receive from the bank. 

Her goal is to buy a car to make her sales more easily.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, tamarind and achiote.

loans.name: Santa Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Santa Lucia ya ha tenido créditos con KIVA los cuales han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda y a pagado puntual mente.
Esta nueva mente solicitando un préstamo ya que le esta haciendo falta la instalación del hidro-sanitaria en su domicilio, y por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora. 
La señora Santa Lucia tiene ya mas de diez años que se dedica a la venta artículos para el hogar y aparatos eléctricos en diferentes partes de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, 
Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito y que con el dinero que le manda su esposo, será para pagar los gastos familiares y escolares de sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Santa Lucia has had Kiva loans that she has used to improve her home and she has repaid them punctually.  

Currently she is requesting this loan because she lacks a water sanitation system in her home and at the moment she does not have the necessary funds to make the improvement.  

Santa Lucia has worked for more than 10 years selling household goods and electrical appliances in different parts of the city of Nuevo Laredo.  With the income she earns from her business she plans to repay the loan and she will use the money her husband sends for the household expenses and her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to install a water sanitation system.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам мужчина в возрасте 33 лет, женат и  имеет двоих детей.  В течение 20 лет занимается откармливанием крупно рогатого скота.   За этот период он достиг много положительного результата.   Жена Рустама в свободное время помогает по откармливанию скота дома.  Рустам покупает скот   откармливает и продаёт их на местном рынке.  Кроме этого Рустам пол дня  работает на кирпичном заводе шофером, имеет собственную грузовую  машину.  Он с 2010 года кредитуется в нашей организации.  В течение 2 лет не разу не нарушал политику организации и своевременно погашал свой полученный кредит.  Рустам ответственный, пунктуальный и честный человек.  Он благодарен таким организациям как Арванд за поддержку и понимание. На полученный кредит Рустам хочет расширить свой бизнес в сфере животноводство и купить крупно рогатый скот.
texts.en: Rustam is a 33 year-old man, who is married and has two children.  He has been involved in fattening up cattle for 20 years.  He achieved a lot of positive outcomes during this time period.  Rustam's wife helps with fattening up livestock at home during her free time.  Rustam buys livestock, fattens it up and sells it at a local market.  Besides this, he works half a day as a driver at a brick plant and has his own truck.  He has been obtaining loans from our organization since 2010.  He has never violated the terms of the organization and timely repaid his loans over the course of these two years.  Rustam is a responsible, punctual and honest person.  He is grateful to organization like Arvand for the support and understanding.  Rustam wants to use this loan to expand his animal husbandry business and buy cattle.

loans.use: to expand his animal husbandry business and buy cattle

loans.name: Rigobert

texts.fr: Rigobert est un homme de 36 ans marié, père de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 4 et 9 ans, tous vont à l'école. Il a aussi une autre personne à sa charge. Il commerçant a ouvert et gère une mini alimentation depuis 4 ans dans laquelle elle commercialise les produits de premières necessité  depuis un an. Il achète les marchandises qu'il revend en petite quantité dans sa boutique et est obligé d'aller au marché tout le temps. Ce crédit lui permettra de satisfaire non seulement sa clientèle grandissante en achetant en cartons pour détailler (un sac de riz un carton de savon, de sucre, de détergent, et des friandises, d'huile...) et lui évitera les allez et venus mais aussi augmentera son profit. Les benéfices générés par ce crédit seront épargnés et réinvestis en partie dans sa boutique pour l'agrandir et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rigobert is a 36 year old man who is married and has three children. Their ages range between four and nine years, and they all attend school. He also has an additional dependent in his care.

He is a merchant who opened his mini-grocery four years ago, and continues to manage it today. There, he has been selling staple commodities for the past year. He buys the supplies for his shop in small quantities and thus is forced to go to the market frequently. This loan will allow Rigobert to satisfy his growing customer base by purchasing his supplies at wholesale to sell at retail. Not only that, but he will be able to avoid coming and going constantly, which will increase his revenue. Some of the supplies he plans to purchase with this loan are: a sack of rice, a carton of soap, sugar, detergent, sweets, and oil.

Rigobert plans to save part of the income generated by this loan to reinvest in and enlarge his shop. The rest he will use to help provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase at wholesale a sack of rice, a carton of soap, sugar, detergent, sweets, and oil.

loans.name: Soern

texts.en:
Soern, 29, is married and has two children; she resides with her family in a rural village of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. Both of her children are dependent and still in school. To feed the family, she has been farming rice and weaving mats for several years. Her husband catches fish and raises pigs locally, to gain more income to better support the family. Together, they can earn about 11,000 KHR per day and can save about 5,000 KHR each day for future needs. Lack of working capital is the main challenge for Soern's business. 

Soern has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one loan cycle and completely paid back the past loan.  It helped her to better support her family. Now she is applying for a new loan with VisionFund, in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR. Soern will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes the fertilizer will enable her to harvest more rice, to increase her family’s income and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Chanda's Group

texts.en:
Chanda is aged 27 years and married, with one dependent son who is still too young for school. She lives in a rural village of the Pursat province’s Kror Kor district and earns a living through farming rice. 

To add up more income, she has been selling fish and vegetables in the local area to better support the family. She can earn about KHR 40,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs.

This is Chanda’s first group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each, Chanda, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy more various kinds of fish and vegetables for selling. 

She hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more various kinds of fish and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Paula Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Amor Y Paz se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos.

En este lugar vive la señora Paula, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos, uno es mayor de edad y dos de 16 y 14 años, el mayor estudia en la Universidad y los dos menores  en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella se dedica junto a su esposo y sus hijos a la agricultura y a la venta de sus productos, cultivan plátano, yuca y maní. Cuando cosechan sus productos los entregan a comerciantes que llegan hasta la zona y también los llevan a Manta, Chone y Portoviejo, ellos también venden los  derivados de estos como el almidón el mismo que entregan en las ciudades antes mencionadas. Trabajan en el campo desde las 07h00 hasta las 15h00, además de ellos también en épocas de duro trabajo contratan otras tres personas a quienes les pagan un sueldo semanal por su labor.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar insecticidas e insumos para la agricultura. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio, es socia fundadora y le gusta por la ayuda que ha recibido.
 
Su meta es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Amor y Paz" meets every fifteen days in the parish of Calderón in the city of Portoviejo. In this area the people work in agriculture, raising livestock and selling their products. 

Paula, 39, lives here and is married to her husband with whom she has three children. One is of independent age and the other two are 16 and 14 years old. The oldest studies at a university and the two youngest go to high school. Her husband makes a living in agriculture.

She works together with her husband and children in agriculture and the sale of their products. They grow plantains, cassava and peanuts. When they harvest their products they deliver them to merchants that come to the area and also bring them to Manta, Chone and Portoviejo. They also sell by-products including cassava starch that they also deliver to the cities mentioned. They work in the land from 7:00 am until 3:00 pm. During the periods of difficult work they contract three workers whom they pay a weekly salary for their work. 

This new credit will be used to buy insecticides and agricultural supplies. She has been in the Communal Bank since it began and is a founding member. She likes the bank for the help that she has received. 

Her goal is for her children to finish their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Dúo El Manzanillo Group

texts.es: Dúo el Manzanillo. este dúo está integrado por la señora Maria Humbelina quien es originaria de San Juan Comalapa ella tiene 38 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos pequeños y se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta de cosméticos ella vende en su casa le da gracias a Dios por haberle dado la oportunidad de su negocito y ahora solicita este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera necesidad y para la compra de cosméticos.
texts.en: One of the members of the Dúo el Manzanillo Communal Bank is Sra. Maria Humbelina, who is a native of San Juan Comalapa. She is 38 years old and has two small children. She sells food products and also has another business selling cosmetics. She makes her sales in her home and thanks God for having given her the opportunity to own a small business. She is now requesting a loan to buy basic food supplies as well as cosmetics

loans.use: to purchase basic food supplies, as well as cosmetics.

loans.name: Washington Raul

texts.es: Washington de 41 años estado casado tiene 1 hijo vive (Orquídeas - Ecuador). El decidió entrar al oficio de ser taxista por la falta de trabajo que existe en el país .se  compro un auto con una liquidación de un trabajo anterior y decidió ser taxista. El trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y ganas todos los días solo. Su mayor temor es la delincuencia en el país pero eso a , El  no le impide que trabaje todos los días porque su mayor sueño es sacar adelante  a su familia A futuro el anhela tener una buena vivienda. Con el préstamo comprara:        (herramientas, llantas para el auto).
texts.en:
Washington is 41 years old, married, has one child and lives in Orquídeas, Ecuador.  He decided to become a taxi driver due to the lack of jobs in his country.  He purchased a car with the settlement from a previous job and decided to become a taxi driver.  He works with a lot of effort and and desire everyday.  

His biggest fear is the crime in his country but that does not stop him from working everyday because his biggest dream is to get his family ahead, as he yearns for a good home.  With the loan he will purchase tools and tires for his car.

loans.use: to buy tools, tires for the car, paint for the car, etc.

loans.name: Edlira

texts.en:
Edlira is 26 years old and married, and lives in a little town in northern Albania with her in-laws, in accord with the region’s family tradition. She’s owned a beauty salon for the past three years, and she says that she has been busy.
 
Yet, she wants to be even busier and set herself apart from competitors in more ways than just one, and for this she plans to add some more services to those she offers at the moment. 

Edlira wants to buy bridal dresses and rent them to women, and this is the reason she is requesting a loan from Kiva. She hopes that lenders will consider helping her out financially. With this in mind, she wants to thank Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy bridal dresses that she can rent out.

loans.name: Hou's Group

texts.en:
Hou, a 46-year-old married mother, lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has three children to take care of. To make a living, she has been farming rice for several years, while her husband also earns extra income by making palm juice in the local area. 

The current business earns her family approximately 23,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Lack of working capital to buy fertilizer for covering her farmland is the main challenge for her business.

Hou’s group consists of three members who are in their first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, Hou will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her cultivated land. 

She hopes this loan will help her to grow her rice successfully so as to improve hygienic living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her cultivated land.

loans.name: Gerardo Ramon

texts.es: Microempresario originario de la cuna  del folklor de Nicaragua agricultor, desde hace 30 años, casado, que se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como frijol, maíz, verduras etc. Tiene 13 años de estar con la institución la cual ha demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de semilla mejorada, insecticidas, abono etc.
texts.en: He is a small business man and native of the cradle of Nicaraguan folklore. He has been a farmer for 30 years and is married. He cultivates basic grains such as beans and corn, as well as vegetables. He has been with ADIM for 13 years and has proven to be responsible in his repayments. He will invest the loan in the purchase of improved seeds, insecticides, fertilizer, etc.

loans.use: to purchase improved seeds, insecticides and fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Kem's Group

texts.en:
Kem, 47, is married and has six children; she resides in a rural village located in the Pursat province’s Kror Kor district, Cambodia. Of her six children, three are still dependent and are in school. For the past twenty-five years, Kem has been farming rice and raising pigs as primary sources of her family’s income.

Kem’s Group consists of two members who live in the same village. Kem, who is the leader, will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland.  She is in her first loan cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. With the fertilizer she will purchase with the loan money, she hopes to increase the yield from her rice paddy, which will improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sas' Group

texts.en:
Sas, 49, is a rice farmer in a rural village of the Pursat province’s Kror Kor district of Cambodia. She has three children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school in the local area. Besides farming rice on 1.5 hectares of farmland, she sometimes works for others for a fee to earn additional income in order to better support her family. Sas has been in this business for several years. From the current business, she is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day. She saves about 15,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
 
Sas is in her first cycle loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for the loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for labor fees. Through this loan, she hopes for a high yield from her farming business, so she can continue to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay labor fees

loans.name: Carmen Amparo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Amor Y Paz se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Calderón de la  ciudad de Portoviejo, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos.

En este lugar vive la  señora Amparo, tiene 39 años, es casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, uno ya es mayor de edad y dos de 17 y 15 años, todos están estudiando la mayor en universidad y los menores en colegio, todos ellos  aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ellos tienen un negocio familiar, se dedican a la producción de chifles. Trabajan todos los días 9 horas al día tanto en la producción como en la entrega de sus productos, ellos  se reparten las tares que hay que realizar, unos en la producción y otros en los recorridos entregando los productos ya que entregan en diferentes tiendas de la localidad y también  en Rocafuerte y Portoviejo en algunas tiendas en dichos lugares. Con ellos además de la familia trabajan tres personas a las cuales se les paga un sueldo semanal por su labor.

Este crédito lo van a utilizar en comprar aceite, manteca y plátanos para cumplir con las ventas y los pedidos que tienen. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque siempre le han brindado gran ayuda con los creditos.
 
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y tener maquinarias industriales adecuadas para la fabricación del chifle.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Amor Y Paz" meets every fifteen days in the parish of Calderón in the city of Portoviejo. In this area the people make a living in agriculture, raising livestock and selling their products. 

Here Amparo lives. She is 39 years old, married and has three children from this relationship. One of her children is already of independent age and the other two are 17 and 15 years old. All of her children are studying, her daughter is at university and the youngest are in high school. All of her children live at home. Her husband is a merchant.

Together they have a family business, producing plantain chips. They work nine hours everyday in producing and delivering their products. They divide the work amongst themselves, some in the production and the others in traveling to deliver their products. They bring their product to several stores in the area and also in some stores in Rocafuerte and Portoviejo. With them, three aditional people work whom they pay a weekly salary. 

They are going to use this product to buy oil, butter and plantains to make their sales and fill the orders that they have. She is a founding member of the Communal Bank and she likes it because the loans have always brought her great help. 

Her dream is to expand her business and have industrial machines that are satisfactory to make the chips.

loans.use: to buy oil, butter and plantains.

loans.name: Norvin Isaac

texts.es: El joven Norvin de la edad de 20 años, soltero sin hijos trabaja en mantenimiento de plantas de tratamientos sépticos desde hace un año para una empresa privada siendo esta su primera experiencia laboral, a su corta edad se preocupa mucho por el bienestar de sus padres. Solicita su segundo crédito con Afodenic para construir un muro perimetral del lado este de su casa para obtener mayor seguridad en su hogar con lo que comprara materiales como bloques, cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín y así ir mejorando las condiciones de vida por lo que espera le sigan brindando apoyo de financiamiento, para seguir apoyando a sus progenitores a mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Norven, a 20 year old young man is unmarried and childless. He has been working to maintain septic treatment plants for a private company for the past year. This is his first job. At his young age, he is very worried about his parents’ well-being.

He is requesting his second loan from Afodenic in order to build a perimeter wall on the east side of his residence in order to provide greater security for his parent’s home. He will purchase materials such as blocks, cement, sand, iron and gravel and thus improve living conditions at his house. He hopes that he continues to receive support and funding so that he can continue helping his parents improve their home.

loans.use: to purchase blocks, cement, sand, iron and gravel.

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru: Дом, где живет Абдурасул, не отвечает стандартам жилья и поэтому он начал строить новый дом с современной планировкой. Ему 51 года, он женат  и на воспитании имеет 5  детей. Детям 25, 24, 22, 20 и 18 лет. Они все работают и учатся в университете. Сыновья Абдурасула хотят женится, но не имеют нормального дома для создания новой семьи. Абдурасулу надо срочно достроить свой дом, но его доход от услуги тракториста не хватает для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как шифер и древесину.   Абдурасул и его дети будут ждать, пока добрые кредиторы помогут им решить проблему жилья.
texts.en: The house, where Abdurasul lives, does not comply with living standards, and this is why he started to build a new house with a modern structure.  He is 51 years old, married and has five children, who are 25, 24, 22, 20 and 18 years old.  All of the children work or study at a university.  Abdurasul's sons want to get married, but do not have a normal house to create their new families in.  Abdurasul urgently needs to finish building his house, but his income from providing tractor-driving services is not enough for this.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to purchase construction materials, such as slate and wood.  Abdurasul and his children will wait until kind creditors help them to resolve the living problem.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as slate and wood, to finish building his house

loans.name: Isezerano Group

texts.fr:
Goreth fait partie du groupe  Isezerano et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 35 ans et mariée à Juma, un commerçant de poissons. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 6 à 19ans. 

Elle fait le commerce d’avocat depuis 8ans,de restaurant  depuis 3mois et des ustensiles de cuisine. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient ,elle  va étendre son restaurant,  et acheter une grande  quantité de produits vivriers(haricot, riz,huile de palme,...) à vendre cuits , et une grande quantité d’avocats à revendre, pour gagner plus.

 Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle et construire une maison, elle voudrait en outre  voir  ses enfants étudier et terminer les études.
texts.en:
Goreth is a member of the group Isezerano and lives in Bujumbura. She is 35 years old and married to a fish merchant named Juma. Together they have three children aged six to 19 years old. Goreth has been an avocado merchant for eight years, and for the past three months has been running her own restaurant.

This is Goreth's second loan cycle with Turame. With her loan from KIVA, she plans to expand her restaurant and purchase food products (beans, rice, palm oil) that she will sell in cooked dishes, as well as a large number of avocados for resale.

In the coming years, Goreth would like to buy a parcel of land and build a house. She would also like to see her children study hard and complete their schooling.

loans.use: to expand her restaurant and purchase food products (beans, rice, palm oil) that she will sell in cooked dishes, as well as a large number of avocados for resale.

loans.name: Yara Elena

texts.es: Yara es una microempresaria de éxitos el cual anteriormente trabajo en grupo solidario varios préstamos como su negocio ha venido creciendo y su cumplimiento en sus pagos fue graduada a la metodología individual por su crecimiento y record crediticio. Inicio su negocio con su hermana ya que su casa de habitación está en un punto estratégico para negocio actualmente vende fritanga todos los días de la semana. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como arroz, frijoles, aceite, productos perecederos, carne de res, carne de pollo, plátanos etc.
texts.en:
Yara is a successful micro entrepreneur. Previously she worked in a solidarity group. With several loans her business has been growing and her commitment to her payments has allowed her to graduate to individual loans based on her growth and credit record. She began her business with her sister since her home is a strategic place for business. She currently sells food made in her home everyday of the week. 

Her loan will be used to buy raw materials like rice, beans, oil, perishable foods, red meat, chicken, plantains, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, red meat, chicken and plantains, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Azucenas De Maria Group

texts.es:
AZUCENAS DE MARIA 
 El grupo esta conformado por  Maria Isabel quien tiene 40 años de edad vive en Caserio el Manzanal  Aldea Sajcavilla, se dedica a la elaboración de Güipiles Típicos a mano desde hace 25 años, ella necesita otro crédito para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos tipicos y poder invertir en sus telas  e hilos que utiliza en sus tejidos de güipiles  y así mismo poder entregar sus pedidos que tiene  en estos meses  ya que se aproxima la época navideña,  su deseo es seguir aumentando sus ventas  y poder  comprar una maquina industrial.
texts.en:
The group includes Maria Isabel who is 40 years old and lives in Caserio el Manzanal in the village of Sajcavilla. She has made a living making traditional Guatemalan woven dresses by hand for 25 years. She needs another credit to buy raw material to make traditional weaves and be able to invest in the fabrics and threads that she uses in her traditional weaves. In addition, she will be able to deliver the orders that she has during these months since Christmas is coming. 

Her wish is to continue increasing her sales and to be able to buy an industrial machine.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make common woven products.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафрузу 33 года. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 2  детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 6 лет назад она начала свой бизнес куплей продажей детской одежды. Ее эффективность помогает ей быть успешной в бизнесе. Она продает свой товар на местном рынке и имеет большой круг клиентов. У нее тонкий вкус и она умеет выбрать товар, который имеет большой спрос. Несмотря на все ее достоинства, мощная конкуренция  делового мира, заставляет ее быть внимательной и обновлять товар каждый сезон. Она должна купить товар для нового сезона, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони  для покупки товара для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту. Давайте, ей поможем держать свой стимул среди бизнесменов.
texts.en: Dilafruz is 33 years old, divorced and raising two children.  In order to provide her family with all of the necessities, she started her own business of buying and selling children's clothing six years ago.  Her effectiveness helps her to be successful in the business.  She sells her merchandise at a local market and has a large circle of customers.  She has sophisticated taste and can choose merchandise that will be in high demand.  Despite all of her advantages, the strong competition of the business world forces her to be attentive and update her merchandise every season.  Dilafruz has to purchase merchandise for the new season, but does not have enough means for this.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 6000 somoni to buy merchandise for the new season.  She awaits your kindness.  Let's helps her to maintain her drive among businessmen.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the new season

loans.name: Shuhratkhon

texts.ru: Шухратхон целеустремленный и мотивированный молодой человек. Ему 30 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 6 лет назад он начал свой бизнес услугами такси.  Его эффективность помогает ему быть успешным в бизнесе. Он хорошо знает тонкости бизнеса и имеет индивидуальный подход каждому клиенту и поэтому у него много клиентов. Он должен купить новую машину, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони  для покупки машины. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте, ему поможем развивать бизнес дальше.
texts.en: Shuhratkhon is a goal-oriented and motivated young person.  He is 30 years old, married and raising two children.  In order to provide his family with all of the necessities, he started his own business of providing a taxi service six years ago.  His effectiveness helps him to be successful in the business.  He knows the nuances of business well and has an individual approach to each customers, and this is why he has many clients.  He must purchase a new car, but does not have enough means for this.  Shuhratkhon is requesting a loan in the amount of 7000 somoni to purchase a car.  He awaits your kindness.  Let's help him to develop his business further.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Soila Margarita

texts.es: Soila tiene 31 años es madre soltera tiene dos hijos pequeños .Inicio ayudando a su mama en la venta de ropa pero decidió independizarse para tener sus propios ingresos  porque tiene responsabilidades que cumplir con sus hijos. Su trabajo lo realiza sola  de lunes a domingos de 08:00 am hasta 18:00pm. Una de las dificultades es que a veces los clientes no le cancelan  a la fecha acordada y tiene que ingeniárselas para poder subsistir ya que es su único sustento. Con el prestamo quiere comprar ropa para hombres y mujeres y asi variar su mercaderia. Su meta es tener su propio local y contar con más mercadería desea dale lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Soila tiene 31 años es madre soltera tiene dos hijos pequeños .Inicio ayudando a su mama en la venta de ropa pero decidió independizarse para tener sus propios ingresos  porque tiene responsabilidades que cumplir con sus hijos. Su trabajo lo realiza sola  de lunes a domingos de 08:00 am hasta 18:00pm. Una de las dificultades es que a veces los clientes no le cancelan  a la fecha acordada y tiene que ingeniárselas para poder subsistir ya que es su único sustento. Con el prestamo quiere comprar ropa para hombres y mujeres y asi variar su mercaderia. Su meta es tener su propio local y contar con más mercadería desea dale lo mejor a sus hijos.    

Soila is 31 years old. She is a single mom and has two small children. She first helped her mom sell clothes but then decided to set up her own business, in oder to have her own income - as she wishes to be a good provider to her children. She works alone from Monday to Sunday from 8 am to 6 pm every day. One of the difficulties she faces is that clients sometimes fail to cancel their orders on time; this means she needs to be very resourceful in order to make ends meet, as this is her only source of income. She would like to use the loan to buy men and women's clothing, so she can offer her customers more varied merchandise. Her goal is to have her own shop and to have more merchandise, as she wants to give her children a better life.

loans.use: to buy men and women's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy small livestock and winter animal feed.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en: Ren is a 52-year-old resident living in a rural area of Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She is a widow with four children, all of whom are employed as paid workers. Ren has five years of experience working as a paid worker and groceries seller. She has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles, with which she succeeded in relieving her family’s burden. She is now leading her group members, Chantha and Mao, to take out a loan in the amount of 2,500,000KHR, 2,500,000KHR, 2,000,000KHR, respectively. With her loan portion, Ren plans on buying pigs and pig feed. After receiving her requested loan portion and efficiently using it, she hopes that the pig-raising business that she plans on doing will help her improve the living standard of her family remarkably.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Srean's Group

texts.en:
Srean is 32 years old, married, and resides in a rural area of Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has three daughters, all of whom are working as farmers. Srean and her husband grow rice on a one-hectare farm and plant sugarcane on a five-hectare farm in order to make a living. These current businesses, which she has been involved in for 12 years, enable her to earn around 8,000KHR per day and save approximately 3,600KHR after offsetting her daily cost of living. 

Srean is a fourth-cycle client with VisionFund and now leading her first-cycle group member, Sengheang, to take out a loan in the amount of 1,200,000KHR in total. The previous loans have helped Srean to relieve her family’s burden as well as improve the living standard of her family. Now with this new requested loan portion, which is 200,000KHR, she plans on buying fertilizer for her farmland. In the future, she hopes that her current businesses grow even stronger so that she can increase her income and improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Leang's Group

texts.en:
Leang, 51, is a resident living in a rural area of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Cambodia. She is married and has seven children, two (sons) of whom are school-aged children and still dependent on her. She earns a living for her family by planting cassava and farming rice, businesses in which she has been involved for 31 years. 

Leang has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles, with which she succeeded in covering the cost of plowing her rice field and cassava field. Now she is leading her group member, Chhreb, who has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle, to request a loan in the amount of 3,000,000KHR in total. Leang will be utilizing her requested loan portion (2,000,000KHR) to buy fertilizer and plots of farmland. She hopes that, after receiving the loan and efficiently using it, her current businesses will provide her with higher crop yields so that she can boost her income and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and plots of farmland.

loans.name: Samoun

texts.en:
Samoun, age 58, is a widowed mother of five, who lives in a village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. Three of her children are in her care and help in the family business. To support the family, Samoun has been farming rice on a 3-hectare plot of farm land for thirteen years, and growing cassava on a 2.8-hectare plot of farm land. The current business earns her 40,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day, after daily expenses. Her main business challenge is the low prices she gets for her crops.
 
Samoun is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan from VisionFund of 4,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizer for her farming business. She hopes to get a high yield, so that she will obtain more income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farming business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov is 46 years old, married, and has three children. She and her family reside in Pursat province’s Kror Kor district of Cambodia. Two of her children are still under her responsibility, while the other one is employed as a rice farmer. A rice farm and pig-raising business provide Pov the main source of income to earn a living for her family. She has been involved in this business for 12 years, enabling her to earn approximately 13,000KHR per day and, after deducting the daily cost of living, be able to save around 7,000KHR. 

Pov has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan cycle, with which she succeeded in meeting her family’s needs in terms of food security. Low quality crop yields and a lack of working capital are the main challenges that she has faced. Therefore, Pov, together with her fellow group member, Chhreb, who is a first-time borrower with VisionFund, are applying for a loan with VisionFund. Pov plans to use her loan portion, which is 500,000KHR, to buy fertilizer to support her rice field and to buy pig feed in order to fatten her pigs. With the help of this loan, Pov strongly believes that her income will increase and the living condition of her family will be better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice field.

loans.name: Cashaloma  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
Cashaloma es un banco comunal que está formando por 7 socias y 3 socios quienes son vecinas y amigas, viven en una misma comunidad y ahora se han unida para obtener un crédito y así poder incrementar su producción agrícola, también laboran en la cría de animales y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones inculcadas por sus padres. Viven por el cantón de Nabón lugar que se encuentra rodeado por montañas gracias a su geografía accidentada con hermosos paisajes para tener paz y relajación fuera de la rutina de la ciudad, su arquitectura nos traslada a tiempos pasados.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Blanca, vive por la comunidad de la Ramada perteneciente al cantón Nabón, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y ha concebido 4 hijos de 17, 9, 7 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo estudian en el colegio  y sus tres hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad, la casa en la que vive es el fruto de su trabajo.
 
Doña Blanca es una mujer luchadora que a pesar de las adversidades siempre está buscando la manera de salir en adelante para darles a sus hijos un mejor futuro. Ella se dedica a la cría de animales como: borregos, cuyes, cerdos, gallinas y ganado, también se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, frejol, arvejas y papas, estos productos  los  vende en su comunidad o en la ciudad y también son para el consumo de su hogar. En su tiempo libre elabora polleras (vestimenta típica), chales y chompas actividad que aprendió por habilidad. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas, abono y telas para continuar con estas actividades económicas. 

Su meta es tener más terrenos cultivados.
texts.en:
Cashaloma is a communal bank that is made up of 7 women and 3 men who are neighbors and friends.  They live in the same community and now have come together to obtain a loan in order to increase their agricultural production.  They also raise animals and many work in the city in various economic activities.  They still maintain the culture and traditions instilled in them by their parents.  They live by the canton of Nabón, a place that is surrounded by mountains with a rugged terrain and beautiful scenery that are peaceful and relaxing alternative to the city routine.  Its architecture transports us to the past.

One of the members of the group is Ms. Blanca.  She lives near the Ramada community which belongs to the Nabón canton.  She is a 34 year old single mother of 4 children aged 17, 9, 7 and 5.  Her first child is in high school and her three other children study in the local school.  The house in which they live is the fruit of her labor.
 
Ms. Blanca is a fighter who despite adversity always looks for a way to get ahead in order to give her children a better future.  She breeds animals such as: sheep, guinea pigs, pigs, chickens and cattle.  She is also engaged in agriculture, planting corn, beans, peas and potatoes.  She sells these products in her community and in the city, and she also consumes them at home.  In her free time, she makes polleras (a typical skirt), shawls and sweaters, an activity which she learned by skill.

She will invest her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fabrics to continue with her business activities. 

Her goal is to cultivate more land.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fabrics.

loans.name: Dúo Tierra De Bendición Group

texts.es: Dúo Tierra de Bendición. Doña margarita es originaria de San Juan Comalapa es casada y tiene 4 hijos a su cargo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de güipiles desde hace varios años su producto lo vende de forma ambulante ya que aún no tiene un ´puesto fijo para vender su producto, ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de güipiles a mano, espera que kiva le pueda ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Dúo Tierra de Bendición. Doña margarita es originaria de San Juan Comalapa es casada y tiene 4 hijos a su cargo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de güipiles desde hace varios años su producto lo vende de forma ambulante ya que aún no tiene un ´puesto fijo para vender su producto, ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de güipiles a mano, espera que kiva le pueda ayudar con el crédito solicitado


Dona Margarita is from San Juan Comalapa. She is married and has four children to care for. She has been making and selling blouses for many years. She sells her wares in different places as she still does not have a fixed stand to sell her products from. She is requesting this loan so she can purchase fabric in order to produce handmade blouses. She hopes that Kiva can help her with the loan she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make handmade güipiles [traditional blouses].

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en:
Sopheak is a 52-year-old villager residing in a rural area of Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She is married and blessed with one beloved daughter who is of school-going age. Sopheak has been involved in her current business, selling grocery items, for five years. Each day, she earns approximately 23,000 KHR. To add more income to the family, Sopheak’s husband works as a rice farmer. 

Sopheak, first-time borrower with VisionFund, is leading her second-time fellow group member, Oun, to take out a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 KHR in total. With her first ever requested loan portion of 2,000,000 KHR, Sopheak will buy fertilizers to support her husband’s business and also use a portion of it to buy grocery items. She believes that, after receiving her loan portion, she will be able to boost her income and use her anticipated income to buy a tractor and hopefully run a new business selling fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Phalin's Group

texts.en:
Phalin is a young farmer from the Kror Lanh district of Cambodia. She is 19 years old and has one daughter.
She and her husband have tackled their family's difficulties by farming rice and raising pigs. She is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day. Phalin's group consists of two female members. Each of them is applying for 1,200,000 KHR.
As a group leader, Phalin's loan portion will be used to buy pigs and pig feed. She hopes to fatten her pigs so that she can sell them at a high price and earn more income for her child's sake.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Bailarinas Del Fraile Group

texts.es: Bailarinas del fraile son un grupo bueno , se llaman así ya, que una ex integrante tenia un grupo de bailo terapia. La señora Silvia es una mujer trabajadora tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 14 años de edad, ambos son estudiantes, su esposo es operador de tráiler y ella se dedica a la venta de comidas en mercados rodantes. Ella antes vendía blancos, pero decidió comenzar con la venta de comidas, ya que su mama era la que se dedicaba a esto, pero le traspaso su negocio a Silvia y a su hermana. Con el crédito va a terminar de pagarle a su mama el traspaso del negocio y va a invertir en productos para la preparación de la comida. A Silvia le gustaría mejorar mas su negocio, para tener a sus clientes en un mejor ambiente y a futuro poder tener otro restaurante y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Bailarinas del Fraile is a good group. They are called this because a former member had a therapeutic dance group.

Sra. Silvia is a hardworking woman, who is 38 years old, married and has two children, ages 8 and 14; both are students and her husband drives a trailer. She works selling food at revolving markets.  Before, she sold linens however she decided to start selling food because her mother had the business before she transferred it to Silvia and her sister.

With the loan, Silvia will finish paying her mother for the business transfer and she will also invest in supplies to prepare the meals.  Silvia would like to improve the business in order to attract customers by offering a better dining experience. In the future she wants to own another restaurant and continue growing.

loans.use: to finish paying for the business her mother transferred to her and to invest in the preparation of more food.

loans.name: Kean's Group

texts.en:
Kean is 36 years old and a married father of three children. All of his children are dependent on him and still in school. The main income of the family comes from farming rice and making palm juice. Involved in this business for ten years, Kean is able to earn about 10,000 KHR per day and can save about 4,000 KHR each day, after paying daily expenses. Low crop yield, as a result of insufficient working capital, is still his main business challenge.
 
Kean has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three loan cycles.  He completely paid back the past loans, which have helped him to constantly support his family with enough food and basic necessities. Now he is leading his group to request a new loan. Kean is going to use his portion of the loan to buy piglets to raise, in order to earn additional income for the family. He hopes to feed his pigs until they are fat and healthy, so as to sell them for a good price and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es: Rosa de 44 años de edad es una señora muy trabajadora y dedicada al bienestar de su familia, ella es madre soltera y vive junto a sus dos hijas menores de edad. Rosa posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad para el hogar, en la cual trabaja desde hace cuatro años, todo con el deseo de brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijas. Rosa solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder surtir su tienda adquiriendo productos alimenticios como: lácteos, embutidos, pan y otros más, también productos como detergente, desinfectantes entre otros. Lo que más desea Rosa es aumentar sus ventas para poder seguir brindándoles todo lo necesario a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 44, is a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family’s welfare. She is a single mother who lives with her two young daughters. Rosa has a store where she sells basic household necessities. She has worked in this business for four years. All of her efforts are geared to providing everything her daughters need.

Rosa is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can restock her store with food items such as dairy products, sausages, bread, and other products. She will also buy detergents, disinfectants, and other items. What Rosa wants most is to increase her sales so that she can continue providing for all of her daughters’ needs.

loans.use: to buy perishable food products, detergents, disinfectants, and other items.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa did not finish a higher level of education because her parents had no capacity to send her to school. She was married early at the age of 19 to her husband who was only 21. At that time, they had nothing, no source of income. Her experiences caused her to become mature and to work to have enough food to eat every day.
Rosa started a business stall as a rolling vendor. She sells tarpaulins, mirrors, and school supplies in different public markets during market days. She is happy that her business is doing well and earns income. When she earns enough capital from her business, she hopes to start a kitchen utensils business. 
Rosa is now 53 and has six children. Through her income from her business, Rosa is able to send her children to school. She has now four employees and her youngest child is in school at a college level of education. Rosa wishes to generate a higher income to continue to send her child to school. She also wishes to borrow P40,000 to buy plastic wares and kitchen utensils. She hopes for the success of her business and her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic wares and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Raising pigs is Romeo's business. He has run this business for more than twelve years. He is also a farmer who grows rice.

Romeo raises nine piglets, one sow and two which are fattening. With this large number of pigs, he is in need of more capital, so he is seeking a loan of PHP 20,000. He will use the money to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for his pigs. He knows that the necessary livestock supplies will help ensure his pigs' good nutrition and enable them to reach their optimum growth. Romeo is looking forward to the success of his livestock business through the continuous financial assistance of all his lenders.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for his pigs.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en: Jovelyn a diligent person with two school-aged children. She has sold fruits and vegetables door-to-door for two years to provide for the daily needs of her family. She is requesting a loan of Php 9,000 to buy additional fruits and vegetables for her business. She hopes in the future to build her own stall where she can display her products.

loans.use: to buy bundles of beans, cabbage, bananas and tomatoes for her store.

loans.name: Dina Yolanda

texts.es: Dina de 34 años de edad, vive junto a sus  hijos y su esposo quien es muy responsable. Dinora posee una tortillería en su casa de habitación en donde posee una tortillería en la cual se encarga  de elaborarlas y venderlas, sus hijos le ayudan a repartirlas en casas de los diferentes clientes. Dina solicita un préstamo para contar con el dinero para comprar maíz por mayor y obtenerlo a precios más bajos, así mismo comprar cilindros de gas propano y cal para elaborar las tortillas, con esto Dina podrá mejorar sus ganancias y brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para el sostenimiento del hogar.
texts.en:
Dina, age 34, lives with her children and her husband who is responsible. She has a tortilla shop in her house where she is in charge of making and selling her products. Her children help with distributing products to the homes of different customers.

Dina is requesting a loan so that she will have the money to buy corn in bulk. This will enable her to obtain lower prices. She will also buy cylinders of propane gas for making tortillas. As a result, Dina will be able to improve her earnings and provide help to her husband so that they can sustain their household.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane gas for making tortillas.

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en: Roselle is 29 years old and married with one child. They live harmoniously in a rural community where she can sell rice, feed, insecticides and fertilizers. She has been operating the business for almost ten years and usually earns a profit of PHP10,000 a month. She uses the money to pay for their daily needs and to save for her child's future. She and her husband hope to increase their income so that they will satisfy their needs and start another business in the future. Roselle aims to improve her business to increase their income. She is asking for additional capital of PHP50,000 to buy insecticides, fertilizers, rice and feed for sale. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business and hopes that someday she will be successful in her plan.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizers, rice and feed for sale.

loans.name: Urbano

texts.en:
Urbano manages a rice farming business in their field. He has been 26 years in the farming business. His wife is a housekeeper. The couple depends only on their earnings from farming, that’s why they strive just to feed their children.

At present, merchant's farm input prices are costly because planting season is near. Urbano is having difficulty in providing his farm needs to continue his farming business. Urbano is applying for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy seeds, insecticides and herbicides for plant care. He hopes to borrow the amount he is applying for to start farming activities.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides and herbicides for plant care.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Lily wants to see her children become professionals someday. She patiently works on her farm to provide her family necessities. Lily is married and has two children. She and her husband are not getting tired doing some rice farming activities just to save some of their expenses. Lily wishes to continue operating the business until her children finish their education. Lily believes that she will reach her wish by continuing to keep on working hard. Lily is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to pay some of the labor cost in farming and buy farm inputs needed in farming. Someday, Lily will attain her wish through the help of her loan.

loans.use: to pay some of the labor cost in farming and buy farm inputs needed in farming.

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es:
El señor Flavio tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Es agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como: maíz y maicillo, también es jornalero realiza trabajos del campo a personas que buscan de su servicio y a su vez ganadero. Actualmente posee 8 semovientes de crianza  (vacas) para la crianza y posteriormente venderlas, y un potreo donde los crían y se alimentan, que es rentado para el pasto de las vacas. Esta actividad la realiza en  conjunto con su esposa, quienes tienen  mas de 21 años de dedicarse ha esta actividad. La familia de Flavio, se dedicaba a la crianza de ganado, él manifestó que la actividad es patrimonio familiar.

Antes de dedicarse al crianza de ganado, trabajaba la agricultura y se dedicaba a prestar servicio como jornal,  estas actividades no eran muy rentables por eso se dedico a la crianza y comercio de ganado. Esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres.

El ganado lo compra en los tiangues cercanos a la zona, que se encuentran en la ciudad a 2 kilómetros del lugar en donde vive, cuando se compran en este tiangue los semovientes son trasladados por la calle arriándolos.

El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de 3 vacas de ordeño, 300 tejas de cemento, 500 ladrillos, 12 bolsas de cemento, 10 quintales de hierro, 1 camionada de arena y pago de mano de obra. Con la inversión dispondrá de ganado para la crianza y aumentara la producción de leche; para procesarla en lácteos, obteniendo un ingreso para la familia y satisfacera la demanda de los clientes.
